(predicted abstract) A thermal reactor having a plurality of elongated reactor bodies which are arranged parallel in a longitudinal direction and in a cross-sectional shape having a square top with a pair of side walls; each with a central axis which is perpendicular; each side wall of each reactor body having a plurality of openings formed therein; the reactor bodies and reactor vessel defining a first chamber; and heat exchange members each extending through a respective opening formed in an adjacent reactor body; the reactor bodies defining a second chamber.
(actual abstract) A reactor shutdown system includes a reactor, a control-rod drive unit that can drive a control rod in pulling and inserting directions with respect to a fuel assembly, a power source that can supply power to the control-rod drive unit, and a power converter that is provided between the control-rod drive unit and the power source, in which when power supply is cut off, the control-rod drive unit inserts the control rod into the fuel assembly to stop nuclear reaction in the reactor, and the reactor shutdown system includes a reactor trip breaker provided between the power converter and the control-rod drive unit, a safety protection-system device that controls the reactor trip breaker to cut off power supply to the control-rod drive unit, and a CCF device that controls the power converter to cut off power supply to the control-rod drive unit.
(title)
Reactor shutdown system

[ 2 ]
(predicted abstract) A power plant is provided which consists of an air blower, a compressor for compressing a working fluid fed from the air blower into a predetermined pressure in a predetermined range and a fuel cell producing electrical power by the reaction of reaction gases fed from the compressor. The fuel cell is located in a duct that leads the reaction gases passing through the fuel cell to heaters. The air blower is composed of a pump body having a discharge port and a discharge valve for controlling the flow rate of the working fluid. For the power plant wherein the discharge port of the air blower is installed at the side of a room where the power plant is located, the discharge valve is provided in the duct or in a discharge port provided in the air blower so as to be opened and closed by means of electrical switching on and off. A liquid cooling means is also provided inlet side of the discharge valve, that is the reaction gas inlet of the fuel cell, or inlet of refrigerating and heat exchanging means, that can cool the discharge valve and liquid cooling means by the working fluid. With this construction, the temperature of reaction gas inlet of the fuel cell is made to pass through the discharge valve and the working fluid can be discharged uniformly.
(actual abstract) The present invention relates to a power plant for generating electrical power having a burner unit, wherein thermal energy can be produced by burning a fuel, a turbine unit, wherein a rotational movement can be produced with the thermal energy, and a generator unit which is driven by the rotational movement to generate electrical power. The power plant is characterized according to the invention in that in order to produce the thermal energy, in addition to the burner unit, an electric heating unit is provided, through which electrical energy can be converted into thermal energy to drive the turbine unit. In addition the invention relates to a method for generating electrical power.
(title)
Power plant and method for generating electrical power

[ 3 ]
(predicted abstract) This invention provides a method and apparatus which enable a processor, for example, in a multiprocessor computer system, to dynamically adjust and optimize the parallelism associated with processing video data by each one of the processors in multiple parallel processing nodes of the system. The preferred embodiment determines a load balance of the processors and to control the parallelism of the processors based upon the determined load balance. The determined load balance is then utilized to improve the performance of the nodes by balancing the processing load of each one of the nodes. As a result, a given parallel processing node may have the highest processing capability by taking advantage of the dynamic characteristics of the parallel processing nodes, in effect, to achieve the lowest processing speed that the system may have. The invention can be implemented in a system in which a parallel processing node has a plurality of processors, each coupled to a local memory through a local bus with the local bus preferably having a data width which may differ from the data width of the local bus in at least one other processor as well as in the direction of the local bus so as not to over-load the local bus. The parallel processing node also includes a multi-processor bridge which can monitor the bus by each processor in an event that a memory is not idle between the processors connected to the bus. The memory is monitored by each processor and a message regarding that memory is stored in one of the local memories. The memory is then accessed to transfer data to the other local memory.
(actual abstract) A system for video decoding includes an interface, a set of cores, an allocator, and a load metric measurer. The interface is to receive a set of encoded video frames. The set of cores is to process data. The allocator is to determine an assignment of the set of video decoding modules to the set of cores. The load metric measurer to measure load metrics for each module of the set of modules during decoding of the set of encoded video frames. The allocator is to determine a reassignment of the set of modules to the set of cores based at least in part on the load metrics.
(title)
Self-adaptive load balance optimization for multicore parallel processing of video data

(predicted abstract) A method, an apparatus, a computer readable medium, a computer system and a computer program for controlling a VoIP client via in-band video signalling are provided in the present disclosure. The method includes a first transmitting step and a second transmitting step. In the first transmitting step, an out-of-band (OOM) signaling message containing the in-band video signalling is generated by an out-of-band (OOO) client, and a channel between an OOM video gateway and a mobile terminal (MT) is established. In the second transmitting step, the in-band video signalling message is transmitted in a wireless mode, and a video communication channel between the OOM video gateway and the MT is allocated by the MT for the in-band video signalling through the channel. The in-band video signalling comprises a signal sent by an application program for communicating with the MT.

The ring elements are disposed such that first major surfaces of adjacent ring elements are oriented toward one another. A plurality of discrete electrical conductors provide an electrical path between the first major surfaces of the interconnected ring elements in the presence of a magnetic field which extends parallel to the longitudinal axis of the apertures. A plurality of discrete conductors provide an electrical path between the second major surfaces of the ring elements in the presence of energy which extend into the ring element and which impinge on a second surface of the ring element. Each of the first major surfaces has a respective conductor extending therefrom and at least one aperture. Notably, each top plated area also covers a contact portion of the ring body that is adjacent to the respective interconnect tab. [ 7 ]
(predicted abstract) Systems and Methods are provided for processing storage requests. Aspects include associating storage request information with a requested storage page from a storage device and identifying one or more virtual machines corresponding to the storage request information. These virtual machines may correspond to a virtual machine group (VCS) that contains a set of physical storage addresses of the requested storage page. A VCS-based management interface is configured to allow the storage request information to be inserted into the requested storage page by processing the storage request information using an attribute-based index that represents the storage request information in a first format. The attribute-based index may be configured to include one or more attributes associated with a logical storage address space that is configured to include a set of data structures corresponding to the virtual machine group. Furthermore, the attribute-based index may be configured to be a set of hash values, which may also represent the set of data structures corresponding to the virtual machine group. A plurality of attributes are provided that may be represented and used to search an attribute-based index to locate the one or more virtual machines corresponding to the storage request information.
(actual abstract) Techniques are described herein which minimize the impact of virtual machine snapshots on the performance virtual machines and hypervisors. In the context of a volume snapshot which may involve (i) taking virtual machine snapshots of all virtual machines associated with the volume, (ii) taking the volume snapshot, and (iii) removing all the virtual machine snapshots, the virtual machine snapshots may be created in a first order and removed in a second order. Specifically, snapshots for busy virtual machines (i.e., virtual machines with higher disk write activity) may be created last and removed first. Consequently, snapshots of busy virtual machines are retained for shorter periods of time, thereby minimizing the effect of virtual machine snapshots on those virtual machines (and their associated hypervisors) that would be most negatively impacted by virtual machine snapshots.
(title)
Methods and systems for removing virtual machine snapshots

(predicted abstract) A semiconductor device includes a substrate of a first conductive type; an epitaxial film of the first conductive type made of a semiconductor material containing nitrogen and formed on a surface of the substrate; an internal semiconductor circuit portion formed in the epitaxial film and having a predetermined circuit configuration; an element isolation film for isolating the internal semiconductor circuit portion from an outside of the semiconductor device; and a via hole provided between the epitaxial film and the semiconductor substrate. The via hole has a side surface coated with a heat treated nitride, whereby an insulation resistance of the via hole to an electric current is low.
(actual abstract) A semiconductor device having a via hole whose side surface is covered with nitride metal is disclosed. The via hole is formed within an insulating region that surrounds a conductive region, where both regions are made of nitride semiconductor materials. The via hole is filled with a back metal and in side surfaces thereof is covered with the nitride metal which is heat treated at a preset temperature for a preset period. Nitrogen atoms in the nitride metal diffuse into the nitride semiconductor materials in the insulating regions and compensate nitride vacancies therein. The interface between the nitride metal and the nitride semiconductor material is converted into an altered region that shows enough resistivity to suppress currents leaking from the via hole metal to the conductive region of the nitride semiconductor material.
(title)
Semiconductor device having via hole coated in side surfaces with heat treated nitride metal and method to form the same

(predicted abstract) An apparatus and methods for calibrating a trackers control amplifier based on a trackers control signal from a trackers control amplifier. The apparatus includes a voltage-to-current converter converting the voltage signal from the amplifier to a current signal, a differential circuit receiving the current signal from the voltage-to-current converter, and a calibration unit receiving the output of the differential circuit. The calibration unit uses the output of the differential circuit to detect an offset in the input signal to the amplifier. The output of the differential circuit further detects a calibration signal which is applied to a bias circuit of the amplifier to adjust the gain, bandwidth, etc. of the amplifier to calibrate the amplifier.
(actual abstract) Apparatus and methods for calibration of envelope trackers are provided. In one embodiment, a power amplifier system includes a VGA that amplifies an RF input signal to generate an amplified RF input signal, a power amplifier that amplifies the amplified RF input signal to generate an RF output signal, and an envelope tracker that generates a supply voltage for the power amplifier. The envelope tracker includes a scaling module that generates a scaled envelope signal based on a power control level (PCL) signal and an envelope signal that changes in relation to an envelope of the RF input signal. The envelope tracker further includes a calibration module that controls an amount of scaling of the scaled envelope signal based on calibration data to compensate for an envelope amplitude misalignment of the envelope tracker. The envelope tracker controls the voltage level of the supply voltage based on the scaled envelope signal.
(title)
Apparatus and methods for calibration of envelope trackers

(predicted abstract) Methods and apparatuses for external control of a mobile device are disclosed. An apparatus includes a proximity module that is associated with a mobile device having an accelerometer and a touch-sensitive screen. The apparatus also includes control logic configured to determine whether the mobile device is supported by an external electromagnetic field, wherein the control logic is further configured to: determine the location of the mobile device using the contact sensing signal; transmit power to the proximity module for a predetermined period of time to prevent the proximity module from driving the mobile device within the predetermined period of time when the mobile device is not supported; and disable the power if the proximity module enters a predetermined state of power.
(actual abstract) A method and apparatus (<b>100</b>) are disclosed for wirelessly communicating by a proximity communication circuitry comprising an antenna with a proximate device (<b>200</b>) according to a proximity communication protocol. The proximity circuitry is disabled when not needed. Voltage in the antenna caused by an electromagnetic power signal (<b>222</b>) is detected when the proximity communication circuitry is disabled. The detection of voltage is independent of whether the electromagnetic signal (<b>222</b>) complies with the proximity communication protocol. An event is triggered in response to the detected voltage. Correspondingly a method and device (<b>200</b>) for externally controlling the apparatus (<b>100</b>) are disclosed in which a user command is detected and responsively to the user command, an electromagnetic signal (<b>222</b>) is transmitted to the apparatus (<b>100</b>) for triggering the event. The electromagnetic signal (<b>222</b>) has a regular wave form.
(title)
Method and apparatus for external control of a mobile device using an electromagnetic signal independently of whether the signal is compliant with proximity communications supported by the mobile device

(predicted abstract) A radio transceiver front-end circuit is provided for reducing its power consumption. In operation, a switch in the low side front-end sub-circuit is on, thereby making the low side front-end sub-circuit and the transmitter sub-circuit inoperative. When the switch is not in effect, power is supplied to the power supply unit according to the present invention. When the switch is in effect, power is supplied to both the low side front-end sub-circuit and the transmitter sub-circuit according to a user's operation. In this manner, during the time when the switch is not in effect, power is supplied to the low side front-end sub-circuit and the transmitter sub-circuit according to the present invention.
(actual abstract) A transceiver front-end circuit for a cellular radio architecture for a vehicle, where the transceiver circuit employs components for reducing power consumption. The transceiver circuit includes a receiver module having a delta-sigma modulator that converts analog receive signals to a representative digital signal in an interleaving process, where the delta-sigma modulator includes a combiner, a low noise amplifier (LNA), an LC filter and a quantizer circuit. The LC filter is a multi-order filter and the quantizer circuit is an interleaving quantizer circuit that interleaves multiple groups of bits from the filter. The order of the LC filter is selectively reduced in situations where a full dynamic range of the cellular radio is not required and a bit resolution of the quantizer circuit is reduced so as to reduce the power requirements of the cellular radio.
(title)

A filter circuit comprises multiple filter stages coupled in series between multiple frequency conversion circuits (fringe) and an antenna. The invention is adapted to substantially attenuate at least one second harmonic, or higher harmonic component, of the input signal to the radio receiver. Each of the multiple filter stages includes an output load switch, a first capacitor coupled between the output of the filter stage and the input of the antenna, and a second capacitor coupled between the output of the filter stage and ground, with the second capacitor being electrically parallel to the first capacitor. The first capacitor comprises a capacitor comprising a capacitor plate disposed at a predetermined distance from the input of the filter stage, to compensate for the input impedance of the filter stage. The capacitor is constructed of a low impedance layer deposited upon a dielectric material layer placed within an interior region of a microstrip line transmission line of a microstrip antenna in a substantially parallel relationship thereto. The capacitor plate is formed by a conductive material deposited upon an inner surface of a dielectric material layer deposited within an inner region of the microstrip transmission line. The second capacitor may comprise a capacitive element formed by a conductive element, electrically parallel to the capacitor plate, and disposed in a spaced relationship thereto.

The SAW filter is implemented as a duplexer with one port terminated to provide a filter for the LTE RX path. The linear duplexer and SAW filter provide filtering for an LMR TX signal and an LTE TX signal which are simultaneously present at an LTE antenna of the radio. The linearity of the linear duplexer which reduces LTE TX and LMR TX signal levels combined with the selectivity of the SAW filter prevents intercept intermodulation in the LTE RX path.

Each level detector output signal corresponds to the maximum or minimum voltage level of the output voltage of the capacitive level detector. The level sensor provides an output level signal for each level detector output signal, each level signal being determined by comparing the output voltage of that level sensor output with the threshold voltage of its respective level detector output signal. A switch allows the output of one level detector to be selected prior to selecting the output of the other level detector. The switch allows the output from the one level detector to be reset when its respective output signal is no longer at the threshold voltage of the other level detector. This allows the first and second level detection circuits to be reset prior to a reset from one sensor to the next when each output voltage of the level detectors are at the same level. The first level detector output signal is ""1"" when its output signal is at the lowest voltage level of the second level detector. The second level detector output signal is ""0"" when its output signal is at the highest voltage level of the second level detector. The second level sensor output signal is ""1"" when its output signal is at the lowest or highest level of the second level detector. This allows a plurality of level detectors to be selected in order after each level is determined. "

(predicted abstract) A power controller (11) has a power switch (20), power switch controller (21) and a load (30) connected in parallel. The load (30) is coupled to the power switch controller (21) through a load and a resonant tank circuit (32-34) in a resonant tank circuit resonant tank circuit (32-34) series resonant inductor (34) and resonant tank circuit (34). A power switch controller (21) control switch (22) is connected in series with the parallel inductor (34) in line and a resonant tank circuit controller switch (23) is connected in series with the series resonant tank circuit (34) in the tank circuit (35). The load (30) is coupled to the power switch controller (21) through a load (30) and a resonant tank circuit resonant tank circuit (31). A resonant tank circuit controller switch (40) is connected in series with the resonant tank circuit series resonant tank circuit (31) in the tank circuit (35). A resonant tank circuit resonant tank circuit (34) is also coupled across the load to form a voltage/current converter. The power controller (11) operates on the first switch in the power switch controller (21) to control the output power of the converter. When the input voltage falls below a predetermined level, the first switch is closed, a zero-voltage switch is created across the inverter inductor. The second switch is subsequently opened to drive the converter output to a level where the converter output is maintained.
(actual abstract) A solid state power control (SSPC) controls flow of current from a power bus to an inductive load. The SSPC utilizes load sharing, in which a plurality of current supply paths are connected in parallel to control and share the flow of current between the power bus and the inductive load. Each current supply path includes a main power switching field effect transistor (FET); a balance resistor, and a secondary FET. The balance resistor is connected between the main FET and the load. The secondary FET shunts the balance resistor when the main FET is turned on, and allows current flow through the balance resistor during a turn-off time of the main FET. The balance resistor modulates gate-source voltage of the main FET in order to compensate for gate-source threshold differences among the main FETs that could lead to unequal current sharing during the turn-off period.
(title)
Solid STTE power controller with parallel MOSFET load sharing

(predicted abstract) A non-rotating connector for a wellbore cementing tool having a tubular body including at least one tubular body port. (actual abstract) A wellbore cementing tool configured for placement in a wellbore or in a drill string, and method of using same. The tool comprises a body having upper and lower members connected by a shear component. A rod is connected to the upper member, and the tool can be lowered with the rod into the wellbore or drill string to a desired depth. At the desired depth, locking means are deployed to lock the tool in position, the tool is sealed, and cement can be injected through the tool to the annulus of the outer casing. In some embodiments the tool is locked using a pushing motion that extends locking members outwardly from the tool to engage the wellbore walls or the inner surfaces of the drill string. Once cementing is completed, the rod is pulled from surface thereby causing the shear component to rupture and the upper and lower members to disconnect, and the upper member can be drawn to surface leaving the rest of the tool downhole. The tool does not require rotation to recover the rod, hence reducing the risk of loosening the threaded connections of lengths of drill pipe.
(title)
Non-rotating connector for wellbore cementing tool

(actual abstract) A method for computer security. A gallery comprising a first identity of a first human person is maintained, the first identity associated with a plurality of tags, with first properties, useful for identifying the first human person. A first Internet search for facial images of the first human person is performed using the plurality of tags. A first facial image is selected from the results of this search. A second Internet search is performed for facial images of other human persons based on second properties that are generated by modifying the first properties of the plurality of tags. A plurality of additional facial images of the other human persons retrieved by the second Internet search is selected. A palette of randomized facial images including the first facial image together with the plurality of additional facial images is presented. Access is denied unless the correct facial image is selected.
(title)
Personal familiarity authentication

(actual abstract) The embodiments described herein provide a method and system for improve link adoption performance in wireless networks. The method for modifying the MCS index for transmission using a computed offset is provided. The offset is calculated based on HARQ feedback of transmissions. A transition probability matrix with plurality of MCS indices is used for selecting the MCS index for transmission based on the highest probability of transition. A pattern sequence of MCS indices is formed and the presence of the pattern is determined in the history of the HARQ transmissions. The frequency of the pattern presence is also determined and the MCS index is selected for the HARQ transmissions. A frequency database of MCS indices is built using source encoding techniques. The transition probabilities that are estimated from the frequency database along with a cost function associated with each MCS index will be used to compute next MCS index.

(actual abstract) Disclosed is a floor assembly for a modular building unit that avoids the need to turn the floor assembly frame over for installation of a floor subsheet, and that likewise provides a modular floor subsheet that may be fitted to the modular building unit without welding, rivets, screws, or other tooling. A floor assembly frame includes side rails that form the exterior, bottom perimeter of the modular building unit, and joists that extent between parallel side rails of the floor assembly frame. The joists are configured at their base on one side with a slot configured to receive one end of a section of a floor subsheet. An opposite end of the floor subsheet is then positioned overtop the joist element that forms the top portion of the slot on an adjacent joist, which opposite end may then be held in place with a pin, clip, or other fastener requiring minimal effort to install. Such assembly allows all components of the floor to be installed from above, thus avoiding the need to invert the frame of the floor assembly during installation. In an implementation, an integrity detection system causes an excitation signal to be injected onto the command signal to cause movement of the physical components at an excitation frequency. This movement is detected in the physical system control loop and isolated by the integrity detection system. If the integrity detection system fails to detect energy in the excitation frequency band, a failure of at least one component of the control system is inferred.

Each symbol may include a plurality of frequency carriers, and may include at least one frequency carrier allocated for each of the client network devices. The plurality of frequency carriers can be allotted to the client network devices according to a partitioning pattern. The master network device then transmits the data frame to the client network devices.

(actual abstract) An amplifier-resident device for protecting amplifiers and loudspeakers from shock transient audio signals from dropped microphones that may use either an amplifier control signal from the microphone or a sequential sampling of the incoming audio (optionally switchable) to determine if a microphone drop, or other shock transient, is occurring. If a shock transient is occurring, the device blocks audio signal access to the amplifier. The audio signal goes through a delay line to allow processing time for detecting a shock transient and switching the shock transient audio signal out of the path to the amplifier. The delay may be variable. The device may be integral to the amplifier or may plug into a microphone jack of the amplifier, allowing use with legacy amplifiers. In an embodiment, the device may store safe, predetermined audio signals to send to the amplifier during, and in place of, a shock transient.

[ 100 ]
(predicted abstract) Methods and devices for sequencing the nucleotide sequence of a mixture of nucleic acids are disclosed. The method and device include a nucleic acid sample comprising a mixture of nucleic acids. The mixture of nucleic acids may include multiple different nucleic acids or nucleic acids complementary to different nucleic acids. An energy transfer sensor is used adapted to detect energy transfer from the nucleic acid sample. The nucleotide sequence of the nucleic acid sample is determined based on the energy transfer. The method of the invention employs a single molecule nucleic acid sequence. The method and device of the invention provide an efficient and sensitive sequence identification method where multiple nucleic acid regions are processed simultaneously.
(actual abstract) Provided herein are systems and methods for nucleotide incorporation reactions. The systems comprise polymerases having altered nucleotide incorporation kinetics and are linked to an energy transfer donor moiety, and nucleotide molecules linked with at least one energy transfer acceptor moiety. The donor and acceptor moieties undergo energy transfer when the polymerase and nucleotide are proximal to each other during nucleotide binding and/or nucleotide incorporation. As the donor and acceptor moieties undergo energy transfer, they generate an energy transfer signal which can be associated with nucleotide binding or incorporation. Detecting a time sequence of the generated signals, or the change in the signals, can be used to determine the order of the incorporated nucleotides, and can therefore be used to deduce the sequence of the target molecule.
(title)
Methods and apparatus for single molecule sequencing using energy transfer detection

(actual abstract) Technologies are generally described for virtual machine memory deduplication protection through memory deduplication masking. In some examples, a virtual machine manager (VMM) that receives data to be written to memory may initially write the data to entries in a temporary shadow paging table and then subsequently opportunistically update the memory and an associated hardware-assisted paging (HAP) table. Upon receiving a read request for the received data before the data has been written to the memory, the VMM may check the HAP table and determine that the requested data is not available from the memory. Upon determining that the received data is not available from the memory, the VMM may respond to the read request by sending the received data stored in the shadow paging table entries.

(actual abstract) Accurate measurements of electrical power at various points of a power grid is becoming more important and, at the same time, is getting more difficult as the old power distribution model of a few, large power generating stations and a multitude of relatively linear loads is replaced by a newer model containing a multitude of smaller, and to some degree unpredictable power sources, as well as a multitude of not always linear and often smart (essentially also unpredictable) loads. Embodiments of the invention provide for high accuracy voltage, current and power measurements of quasi-stationary and stationary waveforms in single and multiple phase power systems. Precision AC voltage, current, phase, power and energy measurements in power networks may be measured with current ranges from 1 mA to 20 kA and voltage ranges from 1V to 1000 kV and in a frequency range from a few hertz to one hundred kilohertz.

The rules relate to one or more types, such as, a number of commands to be executed, a number of operations to be performed, a duration of time in which each command may be executed, a sequence of times in which commands may be executed, a type of command and/or operation to be performed, a type of data to be processed, and an input/output state to be processed. The rules may be generated and stored in an automated knowledge base system. The rules are then utilized, optionally in conjunction with other rules and/or data, to analyze a set of input/output events generated by an agent and/or user. The input/output events are then compared with the rules in the knowledge base system, to determine if a given input/output event matches one of the rules which corresponds to that rule. If a given matched rule is found, this rule is used to determine the action to be taken, and the matched rule is stored and/or processed.

(predicted abstract) An apparatus and method are presented for reducing the resistance of trip mechanisms in a circuit breaker. A non-interfering contact spring that is connected in series with the moving contact of a circuit breaker is formed by a plurality of spring strips that are stacked together. The series connection of the strip spring strips comprises the electrical path through the circuit breaker. Thus, when the moving contact of the breaker contacts and contacts in the circuit breaker open, the contact spring provides the force necessary to move the moving contact to open the circuit. Further, the resistance from the contact spring is reduced by attaching the strips in a predetermined configuration which provides an additional resistance to the contact spring as the current is passed therethrough.

(predicted abstract) A method for using failure casting to manage failures in a computing system, including: a) retrieving a set of failure casting instructions by a computing system; b) executing a set of execution instructions on the computing system to produce a set of results; c) comparing the set of results to a set of reference results; and d) based on the comparison, selecting a set of alternate execution instructions; e) determining whether the set of results conforms to a configuration of a data path and a recovery time of a failed component of the computing system; f) based on the determination, executing the set of alternate execution instructions to produce a second set of results; and g) comparing the second set of results to the set of reference results; and h) based on the comparison, determining a cause of a failure associated with the data path or the recovery time of the failed component.
(actual abstract) A system and method for using failure casting to manage failures in computer system. In accordance with an embodiment, the system uses a failure casting hierarchy to cast failures of one type into failures of another type. In doing this, the system allows incidents, problems, or failures to be cast into a (typically smaller) set of failures, which the system knows how to handle. In accordance with a particular embodiment, failures can be cast into a category that is considered reboot-curable. If a failure is reboot-curable then rebooting the system will likely cure the problem. Examples include hardware failures, and reboot-specific methods that can be applied to disk failures and to failures within clusters of databases. The system can even be used to handle failures that were hitherto unforeseen&#x2014;failures can be cast into known failures based on the failure symptoms, rather than any underlying cause.
(title)
System and method for using failure casting to manage failures in a computed system

(predicted abstract) A substrate containing an array of microcapsules is removed from the surface of a semiconductor integrated circuit by applying a magnetic force to the surface of the integrated circuit. The magnetic force is applied to a location adjacent the microcapsules.
(actual abstract) An enhanced thermal interface material (TIM) gap filler for filling a gap between two substrates (e.g., between a coldplate and an electronics module) includes microcapsules adapted to rupture in a magnetic field. The microcapsules, which are distributed in a TIM gap filler, each have a shell that encapsulates a solvent. One or more organosilane-coated magnetic nanoparticles is/are covalently bound into the shell of each microcapsule. In one embodiment, (3-aminopropyl) trimethylsilane-coated magnetite nanoparticles are incorporated into the shell of a urea-formaldehyde (UF) microcapsule during in situ polymerization. To enable easy removal of one substrate affixed to another substrate by the enhanced TIM gap filler, the substrates are positioned within a magnetic field sufficient to rupture the microcapsule shells through magnetic stimulation of the organosilane-coated magnetic nanoparticles. The ruptured microcapsule shells release the solvent, which dissolves and/or swells the TIM gap filler, thereby reducing the bond strength between the substrates.
(title)

(predicted abstract) A method and apparatus for providing a wireless service are disclosed. A base station (BS) generates a service request to a target station (STS) to provide a service. Each of the STS and the BS is assigned a unique resource block (RAB) which defines a transmission time interval (TTI) for transmitting the service. The BS determines whether or not the target station has the service through an inter-nodal channel. If the target station has the service through the inter-nodal channel, the MS transmits a synchronization frame (SM) to the target station in an initial stage of a transmission time interval (TTI) of the RAB assigned. If the target station does not have the service through the inter-nodal channel, a frame of the STS is transmitted to the target station in an end stage of the same RAB within the same RRI. The service will be transmitted during the same RRI with a same SRS.
(actual abstract) The disclosure generally relates to optimized always-on wireless service using network assistance and keep-alives. More particularly, in response to a user equipment (UE) requesting a bearer for an always-on service, a network may establish the bearer for the always-on service and transmit an availability time that indicates a period during which the bearer will be held in an active state to the UE. Any applications running on the UE may then use the bearer for the always-on service, and the UE may transmit a single keep-alive message to the network before the availability time expires to reset the period during which the bearer will be held in the active state. Furthermore, the keep-alive message may be structured to not generate a reply and thereby reduce battery consumption, reduce communication overhead, and improve network capacity.
(title)
Optimized always-on wireless service using network assistance and keep-alives

The receiver compares the first hash value to the second hash value and enables operations of the receiver when the first hash value equals the second hash value.

By controlling the pressurization of the first and second fluid, the volume can be maintained between the initial compressed volume and the maximum expanded volume. In response to the pressurization of the first and second fluid, the volume can be deformed from the initial compressed volume to the maximum expanded volume or from the maximum expanded volume to the initial compressed volume or from the initial compressed volume to the maximum expanded volume.

Increasing the cross-sectional area of the vicinity of the center part of the beam reinforcing metallic material allows the part that receives maximum stress to securely obtain the flexural strength when the beam reinforcing metallic material is fixed to the beam.

Characteristics of the first and second radio frequency signatures may be analyzed to evaluate a relationship between the first and second radio frequency signatures. It may be determined whether or not the first and second radio transmitters are integrated within a common wireless electronic device based upon the evaluated relationship between the first radio frequency signature and the second radio frequency signature. Characteristics and behaviors associated with the wireless electronic device may be determined therefrom.

(predicted abstract) A digital signal processing system and method for use with a multi-step equalizer system is provided. In one embodiment of the invention, the equalizer system utilizes feedback loops in the time-domain, wherein each feedback loop includes an integrator configured to integrate a feedback signal from the previous loop and determine the sign of the resulting signal. According to one aspect, the feedback loops may share a common phase-locked loop (PLL) or a phase-locked loop that generates a reference frequency signal based on a frequency ratio between a first signal and a second signal. According to another aspect of the invention, the system determines the feedback signal of a loop based on a phase difference between the first and second signals. According to still another aspect of the invention, the system enables the equalizer system to be used with any time-domain loop configuration, while employing a single-loop configuration.
(actual abstract) Circuits, devices, methods for decision feedback equalization are described. A decision feedback circuit can include L N-tap decision feedback equalizer (DFE) branches. The L N-tap DFE branches can include K unrolled DFE branches, and L&#x2212;K unfolded DFE branches. Each DFE branch can include a pre-computation stage configured to generate a set of tap-adjusted inputs, each tap-adjusted input corresponding to a possible value for at least one previous output of the same DFE branch. Each unrolled DFE branch can include a multiplexer circuit having selection lines for selecting from the set of tap-adjusted inputs for the unrolled DFE branch, the selection lines being connected to outputs of other DFE branches. Each unfolded DFE branch can include a multiplexer circuit configured to select at least one output from the set of tap-adjusted inputs based on tap-adjusted inputs from other DFE branches.
(title)

(predicted abstract) Method and apparatus is provided for performing adaptive volume per motor revolution system adjustment. In one embodiment, adaptive volume per motor revolution system includes a processor, a memory, and an adaptive volume per pulse generator. The adaptive volume per pulse generator uses a phase velocity algorithm to generate pulse pairs with a minimum pulse width and constant angle of the pulse pairs. The volume per pulse generator processes the pulse pairs into a pulse series. An adaptive volume per pulse control module is provided to control the volume per pulse generator in response to the volume per pulse series. The adaptive volume per pulse control module computes volume per pulse pair adjustment values, and applies each adjustment value to one of two input of a volume per pulse generator. The volume per pulse generator uses the pulse series adjustment values for each pulse to adjust volume per pulse pair adjustment values for all pulse pairs in the pulse series.

(predicted abstract) A method is proposed by means of which a slave clock is synchronized to a master clock based on characteristics of the pulses of clock signals that are transmitted by the slave clock to the master clock. In particular, it is proposed that the slave clock also transmit data signals, the clock-signal characteristics of which are measured by the master clock, which data signals are synchronized to the clock pulses of the slave clock, and that, by means of the correlation of the clock pulses that are transmitted by the slave clock to the data signals that are synchronized with the clock pulses of the master clock, a timing difference between the data signals and the clock pulses which is associated therewith is determined.
(actual abstract) Methods, media, and systems are provided for characterizing the synchronization behavior of a slave clock. A sequence of sync packets, usable to synchronize with a grandmaster clock, is transmitted from the grandmaster clock to a slave clock. The sequence of sync packets is modified by dropping one or more sync packets from the sequence, providing a pattern of dropped sync packets. A synchronization output of the slave clock is monitored and, based on the synchronization output, a determination is made as to whether the slave clock is synchronized while the sequence of sync packets is modified. A characterization of the synchronization behavior of the slave clock is stored with respect to the pattern of dropped sync packets. The process may be repeated for various patterns of dropped sync packets.

[ 200 ]
(predicted abstract) A method and apparatus for simultaneously localizing and mapping a mobile robot environment for different environments. The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for identifying the mobile robot environment using signal strength and a signal quality, and the method and apparatus for providing location-based data of the mobile robot environment to an external device.
(actual abstract) Techniques that optimize performance of simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) processes for mobile devices, typically a mobile robot. In one embodiment, erroneous particles are introduced to the particle filtering process of localization. Monitoring the weights of the erroneous particles relative to the particles maintained for SLAM provides a verification that the robot is localized and detection that it is no longer localized. In another embodiment, cell-based grid mapping of a mobile robot's environment also monitors cells for changes in their probability of occupancy. Cells with a changing occupancy probability are marked as dynamic and updating of such cells to the map is suspended or modified until their individual occupancy probabilities have stabilized. In another embodiment, mapping is suspended when it is determined that the device is acquiring data regarding its physical environment in such a way that use of the data for mapping will incorporate distortions into the map, as for example when the robotic device is tilted.
(title)
Method and apparatus for simultaneous localization and mapping of mobile robot environment

[ 205 ]
(predicted abstract) A method and apparatus for determining a line feed error in a label printer. An actual feed error is determined for a label that is fed in to the printer. A print control is then used to calculate a plurality of actual feed errors. The plurality of actual feed errors are then integrated over a plurality of labels to determine the actual feed error.
(actual abstract) A system to calculate line feed error in labels on a printer includes a holder assembly under the label line feed and before the printer burn line; a first sensor and a second sensor on the holder assembly, a fixed distance, L, between them; and a processor. The first sensor senses a first position of a label edge, L1A. The second sensor senses a second position of the label edge, L1B. The processor calculates the distance, L1AB, between the first position and the second position and calculates the line feed error over the fixed distance, L, by taking the difference (L&#x2212;L1AB). The processor calculates the feed correction to be done to the label, given by [(L&#x2212;L1AB)/L]&#xd7;D, where D is a distance between the first sensor and the burn line of the printer. The processor instructs the printer line feed to implement the calculated feed correction.
(title)
Method and system to calculate line feed error in labels on a printer

(predicted abstract) " The present invention is directed to a combination of an apparatus and methods for automatically detecting levels of water in the interior area of a building of a type which utilizes a level detection station to detect a liquid level indicative of a desired water level within a building and to determine an actual water level based on the desired water level. In particular, the present invention includes an electronic level detection station that utilizes a magnet to produce a magnetic field which is directed toward a predetermined location within the interior of a building, at various locations about its perimeter, such location being designated as a ""detect"" location. As the magnet passes through the building, it produces a magnetic field which is directed toward the detection location. Furthermore, the level detection station produces a level detection signal indicating the position of the magnet relative to the detection location. As the magnet passes out of the interior of the building, it produces a magnetic field which is directed to the predetermined location within the interior of the building. Furthermore, a processor within the level detection station determines the actual water level based on the magnetic field and the level detection signal, and provides a control signal in response thereto. A controller is adapted to connect the level detection signal to the controller, receive the control signal, and move a movable barrier into an opening in the building interior to allow the magnet to pass therethrough, such movement being determined by a control signal. After the magnet has passed through a building interior location, the controller can either automatically move the movable barrier or allow the magnet to pass through the stationary building location in order to produce a level detection signal, which indicates to the processor the position of the magnet with respect to a predetermined level of water in the building interior. Since the magnet is spaced from the monitoring location, the processor can provide an indication of a desired level of water of the building interior based upon the position of the magnet as well as the position of the barrier. "

The spirit type level of the invention can be quickly and easily removably attached to the object to be leveled thereby freeing the hands of the user to position the object.

(predicted abstract) Digital video data is encoded as a series of blocks. Each block is then divided into a series of subblocks, with each subblock having a data packet, a check packet and a quantized prediction data packet. The data packets including blocks of video data are provided to a block encoder. The block encoder combines the data packets in the blocks of data into a continuous stream of block data comprising a series of encoded subblocks. Each encoded subblock is then divided into subblocks of video data, and in every subblock of subblocks of video data is a data packet. The check data packets are provided to a random-access memory to detect the number of blocks of coded video data to be output. The check data packets are provided to a check sequence generator to generate check sequences. The data packets from different blocks are output from the random-access memory to the block encoder. The encoded data and check data packets are then combined with each other by the block encoder into a continuous stream of video data blocks comprising a series of encoded subblocks. Each subblock is then divided into subblock code packets and output therefrom.
(actual abstract) Reframing is used to re-size an image or video content, e.g. for displaying video signals with a given aspect ratio on a display having a different aspect ratio. Window cropping parameters (position and size over time) are constrained in order to optimise the rate/distortion of the encoded output video signal. Initial reframing is improved by computing a saliency map representing a user attention map which considers the video coding context and by providing a macroblock coding efficiency cost map and then taking the saliency map or a combined saliency/coding cost map into account so that the coding cost for said reframed video signal is smaller than the coding cost for other candidate reframing windows' sizes and positions.

The yarn creel assembly further comprises an inclined feed belt assembly supported in fixed, co-linear, spaced-apart relation across a front opening of the spindles for receiving yarn from one of the yarn feeders and feeding the same downwardly through each tube at least substantially concurrently with the upper inclined portion of each tube. This belt comprises a plurality of individually vertically spaced belt sections each having a first surface contacting the upper concave surface of an associated tube and a second surface spacedly engaging and extending substantially horizontally inwardly from the wall of the tube toward a centerline of the tube, for supporting and feeding yarn received from one of the spindles in a manner extending substantially horizontally outwardly of the tube toward a package station below where one or more packages are disposed. The belt is preferably constructed of a porous material and substantially fills the plurality of tubes of each spindle.
(actual abstract) A yarn creel assembly includes a vertical frame, a plurality of vertically spaced package holders, and a vertically disposed arcuate yarn guide. The package holders are mounted on the frame and adapted for carrying respective yarn packages, whereby a tail end of a first yarn package is attached to a head end of a second yarn package. The arcuate yarn guide extends between adjacent package holders, and is adapted for guiding a moving end of yarn drawn from an emptying first yarn package and transitioning to a full second yarn package.

A third downmix processor (24) determines an inverse of 1/2 (j, j=0, 1), and then the first downmix processor (20) uses this inverse to derive the m.sup.th order derivative of the input signal X.sub.i in order to generate a representation of the B.sup.2.sup.m+1 modulated channel signal. The method provides an efficient structure with good quality, to minimize the number of samples required for downmix processing while improving the quality of the resulting signal in both spectral and frequency domains.
(actual abstract) There are two representations for Higher Order Ambisonics denoted HOA: spatial domain and coefficient domain. The invention generates from a coefficient domain representation a mixed spatial/coefficient domain representation, wherein the number of said HOA signals can be variable. A vector of coefficient domain signals is separated into a vector of coefficient domain signals having a constant number of HOA coefficients and a vector of coefficient domain signals having a variable number of HOA coefficients. The constant-number HOA coefficients vector is transformed to a corresponding spatial domain signal vector. In order to facilitate high-quality coding, without creating signal discontinuities the variable-number HOA coefficients vector of coefficient domain signals is adaptively normalized and multiplexed with the vector of spatial domain signals.
(title)
Method and apparatus for generating from a coefficient domain representation of HOA signals a mixed spatial/coefficient domain representation of said HOA signals

(actual abstract) The present invention relates to a pulsed level gauge system comprising frequency control circuitry. If the acquired signal indicates that the time between the previous filling level determination and the present filling level determination is longer than the predefined time, the frequency control circuitry iteratively regulates at least one of the transmit signal generating circuitry and the reference signal generating circuitry towards achieving a desired pulse repetition frequency difference between the pulse repetition frequency of the transmit signal and the pulse repetition frequency of the reference signal.

(predicted abstract) In accordance with one embodiment of the present invention, there is provided a semiconductor device having a transistor and a capacitor. A first silicon nitride layer is formed over a gate dielectric layer of the transistor. A second silicon nitride layer is formed over the first silicon nitride layer and the gate dielectric layer. The second silicon nitride layer is etched to expose a portion of the gate dielectric layer and expose the first silicon nitride layer in a drain region of the transistor. A layer is formed over the second silicon nitride layer to fill a bottom portion of the etched region and form a bottom electrode. The first silicon nitride layer has a higher etch rate than the second silicon nitride layer in an etch process performed to the first silicon nitride layer. An upper electrode is formed over the layer. The first silicon nitride layer is etched to expose source and drain regions of the transistor. A second dielectric layer is formed over the bottom electrode and the upper electrode. The second dielectric layer is oxidized after the second silicon nitride layer etching. The first silicon nitride is etched to expose the source and drain regions. The first silicon nitride layer is etched to expose a side portion of the upper electrode. The upper electrode is formed.
(actual abstract) A method for fabricating semiconductor device is disclosed. (predicted abstract) It is proposed to prepare a non-aqueous dispersion of active carbon, of which the mean particle size is smaller than 5,000 .ANG., by pyrolysis of a starting carbon, which comprises a) dispersing of the starting carbon through application of mechanical mechanical energy or chemical energy, to form a suspension of solid particles of the starting carbon in a liquid dispersing medium; and b) reducing the temperature of the suspension to a temperature below the melting point of the starting carbon, and in that the reducing is carried out so as to maintain a temperature level of the suspension within the range of 5 to 200.degree. C.; c) separating out the solid particles from the liquid in suspension.
(actual abstract) A method of production of active carbon by pyrolysis of organic materials, includes pyrolysis unit, reforming unit, drying unit, purification unit, gas storage unit and high temperature regenerative combustion unit. Organic materials are subjected to pyrolysis reaction in pyrolysis unit to produce combustible gas, tar and char. Combustible gas is reformed through reforming unit then enters into the drying unit for drying organic materials. One part of the purified combustible gas is combusted in the direction of combustion channel in the high temperature regenerative combustion unit, and the combustion heat is produced. At the same time, another part of combustible gas exchanges heat in the direction of heat exchanger channel in the regenerative combustion unit. Then it is used as pyrolysis activation medium entering into the pyrolysis unit in process of pyrolysis and activation reaction. The char is activated by the combustible gas in the pyrolysis unit then forms activated carbon. The sensible heat of the combustible pyrolysis gas is fully released through drying unit. A part of the combustible gas is combusted to produce heat as the required energy source of pyrolysis process. The combustible gas is used as pyrolysis medium and activator in the generation process of active carbon.
(title)
Method for preparation of active carbon by pyrolysis of organics

(predicted abstract) A method for determining rotational eccentricity of a rotating rotor is provided which is capable of detecting a high degree of eccentricity of the rotor without being affected by an increase in the rotation speed. An eccentricity device includes: a detector for determining a reference position in which rotation of the rotor is substantially stable; a detector for determining a current position in which rotation of the rotor is substantially stability at a predetermined time; and an eccentricity processing portion for determining an eccentricity of the rotor based on the reference position, the current position and a predetermined characteristic curve.
(actual abstract) A method is provided for determining current eccentricity of a rotating rotor which is equipped with a phase marker scanned at constant speed of rotation up to 500 rpm by a sensor of a phase marker at the point of the phase marker, and outside of the phase marker by at least one sensor of relative rotor vibrations, while after digitizing the signals of the sensors, estimates current position of the phasor of the 1<sup>st </sup>harmonic component of signal of the sensor of relative rotor vibrations in the complex plane, which is subsequently compared to a reference position of the phasor of the 1<sup>st </sup>harmonic component, which has been determined in advance, whereas the variation vector of the phasors is an image of eccentricity of the rotor. Further, a method of diagnostics of eccentricity of a rotating rotor is based on this method for determining current eccentricity.
(title)

(predicted abstract) The filter element is formed from a stack of paper-based sheets of filter material positioned with their inner faces into a three-dimensional configuration having an open interior. After a number of the sheets of filter material have been positioned in a manner with at least the edges of adjacent sheets of filter material contiguous, the two-dimensional configuration is formed into a honeycomb structure with cells extending in the longitudinal direction of the element. A layer (14) of permeable material is positioned at least partially between opposed faces of the stack of filter material. The permeable material forms one or more outer layers of the element, the cell walls of which define the open interior of the honeycomb. After an external fluid to be filtered is added to the open interior, the fluid passes through the permeable material and flows out of the open interior. Since the cells that extend in the longitudinal direction of the structure are filled with the permeable material, the flow rate of the fluid that passes through the permeable material are approximately 20 m/min. This results in a filtering effect and a reduction of the flow resistance of the device.
(actual abstract) A filter element has a filter body of at least one layer of a flat web-shaped filter medium, separating a raw side from a clean side of the filter element. A hot melt system is provided and the filter body is glued together by the hot melt system. The hot melt system has a hot melt mixture that is made up of 15-85% by weight of a first hot melt that is polyester-based and 15-85% by weight of a second hot melt that is polyamide-based. The first hot melt and the second hot melt together amount to 100% by weight of the hot melt mixture. The hot melt mixture constitutes a proportion of more than 75% by weight of the hot melt system. The remainder of the hot melt system is made up of fillers, pigments, tackiness-imparting resins, and hot melts based on a polycondensate.
(title)

[ 265 ]
(predicted abstract) For each uplink channel there is provided a downlink control channel to transmit downlink control information in a downlink control channel message that includes both downlink and uplink control information. The downlink control channel message may or may not contain resource allocation information for performing the uplink control channels, as is used if there is no uplink control channel to transmit the downlink control information. The downlink control channel message may also indicate the number of uplink channels for a downlink control channel that will be used for the respective uplink channel if a next downlink control channel message indicates that the uplink control channel will not be used since the respective channel is used for transmission of the downlink control information. Alternatively, the control channel may be used in the uplink control channel so that the next downlink control channel message includes an indication of the number of uplink control channels to be used for the downlink control channel.
(actual abstract) A method and apparatus are described for implementing a reset procedure for radio link control (RLC) using radio resource control (RRC) signaling. A wireless transmit/receive unit (WTRU) receives a request for RLC reset. A processor at the WTRU comprises a RRC entity and a RLC entity. The RRC entity receives the request for a RLC reset in a radio resource control message. The RLC entity reassembles RLC service data units (SDUs) from any protocol data units (PDUs) that are received out of sequence at a receiving side of the RLC entity. The reassembled SDUs are delivered in sequence to a packet data convergence protocol entity (PDCP). At the receiving side of the RLC entity, any remaining PDUs that are not able to be reassembled are discarded. At a transmitting side of the RLC entity, all SDUs and PDUs stored in transmit buffers are discarded.
(title)

At a time when the drive spring is in its distal end state, the drive spring is brought into a state in which it is bent at a tip side of the main body, and the syringe is set in the distal direction. Stacking multiple copies of the star topology baseline network creates a multi-planed switching topology for transporting packet traffic. Point-to-point unified stacking method using global switch wiring methods connects multiple planes of a baseline topology by using the global switches to create a large network size with a low number of hops, i.e., low network latency. Grouped unified stacking method increases the scalability (network size) of a stacked topology.

[ 293 ]
(predicted abstract) Methods and apparatus for performing a feedback and loop mode lock, PLL-based control, the same as that for PLL-based gyroscopes by using a single-bit PLL-based device are described. A feedback loop is provided that includes a phase locked loop, a gain control loop, and a quadrature lock loop. The phase locked loop is used to compensate for a voltage-controlled oscillator (VCO), which is controlled by a voltage control signal being applied to the VCO. The gain control loop detects and cancels noise generated in the VCO from noise generated by the phase locked loop. The quadrature lock loop is used to apply phase and frequency signals to the VCO to thereby adjust the frequency of the VCO. The gain control loop may be used to provide a high gain state at the highest gain of the feedback loop and to determine when to adjust the frequency of the VCO. The gain control loop maintains the VCO in a high gain state when the phase detector detects a maximum phase of noise. The gain control loop may be used to provide a very high gain at the lowest gain of the feedback loop.
(actual abstract) This application discusses simplified interface circuits for a gyroscope. In an example, an interface can include an automatic gain control (AGC) circuit configured to couple to driver for a proof mass of a gyroscope sensor and to drive the proof-mass to oscillate at a predefined oscillation amplitude, and a phase-locked loop (PLL) configured to receive sensed oscillation information from the proof-mass and to provide at least a first phase signal synchronized with a sinusoidal waveform of the sensed oscillation information.
(title)
Apparatus and methods for PLL-based gyroscope gain control, quadrature cancellation and demodulation

(predicted abstract) A system, apparatus and method for a vertical satellite positioning system (VPS) which utilizes vehicle navigation data and positioning data from GPS stations located within a selected range to determine an aircraft's position and trajectory and provides vehicle position information to the aircraft without additional hardware and logic for GPS time tracking. In a first embodiment the system utilizes a GPS satellite to provide an indication in the form of a VPS signal which serves as a common reference when the VPS signal is received on the same satellite used by the navigation station and on a different satellite. A time of flight (TOF) receiver on the GPS satellite tracks the satellite position, and in this case, provides the time of flight information to the vehicle to enable precise position estimates to be obtained. In the second embodiment, the system is used by a navigation station to provide an indication in the form of an electronic signal for a GPS satellite. The navigation station provides the time of flight information to the vehicle to enable precise position estimates to be obtained. In this instance, the user of the vehicle can use the vehicle's GPS receiver to determine the amount of time and the time difference between the vehicle's arrival at a selected time on the same satellite as the GPS satellite. For example, if the user is a stationary aircraft, the GPS station would be stationary and be used to determine the arrival time of the GPS satellite. In the third embodiment, the navigation station can provide a time of flight data and vehicle position information to the aircraft for a selected time period, and this time of flight data and vehicle position information would be used for accurate position estimates to be obtained.

The VTOL aircraft may further includes one or more retractable pogo supports, wherein a retractable pogo support is configured to deploy from each of the wing's distal ends.

The system limits the inflation pressure such that a safe quantity of gas would be released should a leak occur. If the amount falls below a certain threshold level, gas or fluid egress is presumed and the inflation process is halted.

(predicted abstract) A system and method for collision avoidance in a vehicle utilizes an approach to detecting vehicle collision and preventing collision avoidance when vehicles are in a state of collision. In one embodiment, first and second sensors, or sensors, provide an input signal that is supplied to an electronic computer that calculates an optimum collision avoidance setting based upon a model of traffic of a path by which the vehicle is to exit the path. A collision avoidance algorithm is stored in the computer memory with each algorithm having one or more parameters that can be associated with one of a plurality of possible collision avoidance settings. When the vehicle is not within the path of a given model, the computer calculates a new optimum collision avoidance setting from one or more of the one or more parameters for the given model. When the vehicle is beyond the path of the given model, the computer performs a predetermined algorithm to set the optimum collision avoidance as the calculated collision avoidance setting. Upon receiving a vehicle collision signal, the electronic computer compares the collision signal to the calculated collision avoidance setting and, based upon a successful comparison, the electronic computer changes the predetermined algorithm of the stored collision avoidance algorithm.
(actual abstract) The disclosure is related to a system and a method for collision avoidance for vehicle. In the method, the system predicts multiple routes of an abnormal vehicle in a period of time according to historical data when a nearby vehicle receives an alert from the abnormal vehicle. A route potential pattern can be created when the system gets the historical data. The system also computes one or more available routes for the nearby vehicle based on its vehicle information. Every available route has its collision risk value. The system finally provides a recommended route with lower collision risk value when it considers a time of the abnormal vehicle reaches its great change, a time of predicting the nearby vehicle meets the range of route potential pattern, and a safe distance there-between.
(title)
System and method for collision avoidance for vehicle

(predicted abstract) A multi-sensor distillation and multi-stage flash evaporation system that may be used to remove and recover and separate light components from organic and aqueous media is disclosed. The distillation and flash evaporation system is particularly designed to eliminate the need for a pre-scent conditioner or other prior art processing, heating, and vacuum equipment, and it may be used in many applications where conventional processing, heating, and vacuum equipment need to be implemented. The system may, therefore, be used in a system that has a single separator between a pressure pump and a heating vessel where distillation and flash evaporation are employed, or alternatively, used in a system that has multiple separators and multiple heating vessels. Furthermore, the multi-sensor distillation and flash evaporation system of the present invention allows for substantially complete removal of the light components from water, such as a dilute fuel or glycol, while preventing undesirable side reactions.
(actual abstract) The combination multi-effect distillation and multi-stage flash evaporation system integrates a multi-stage flash (MSF) evaporation system with a multi-effect distillation (MED) system such that the flashing temperature range of the MSF process is shifted upward on the temperature scale, while the MED distillation process operates in the lower temperature range. The multi-stage flash evaporation system includes a plurality of flash evaporation/condensation stages, such that the multi-stage flash evaporation system receives a volume of seawater or brine from an external source and produces distilled water. The multi-effect distillation system includes a plurality of condensation/evaporation effects, such that the multi-effect distillation system receives concentrated brine from the multi-stage flash desalination system and produces distilled water.
(title)
Combination multi-effect distillation and multi-stage flash evaporation system

A support structure, such as a perforated plastic membrane, is attached to the opened end of the outer tube between the closed end and the closed end of the outer tube, to permit passage of fluid therethrough, but preventing passage of gas therethrough. An inner fluid chamber is formed between the perforated membrane and the closed end of the outer tube by sealingly affixing the perforated membrane to the opened end of the outer tube. An end cap of gas impervious material is provided having a hollow interior, a fluid permeable inlet port disposed inside the hollow interior of the end cap, and a gas impermeable outlet port disposed out of the hollow interior of the end cap. The fluid permeable inlet port and the gas impervious outlet port are positioned so as to permit fluid passage into and out of the hollow interior of the end cap, and to permit gas to pass through the end cap. The gas impermeable outlet port is positioned to permit gas to flow out of the hollow interior of the end cap to a point outside the container. An end cap cap, which is formed of gas impermeable material, is also disclosed for the storage of an end cap of gas impervious material as a function of the gas permeability of the gas permeable inlet port. The container for storage of a support structure and for transport of said support structure within a fluid by gas permeation includes an outer tube and an inner tube.

[ 389 ]
(predicted abstract) A method and apparatus are provided for compressive acquisition and recovery of dynamic image signals in the presence of noise. In one embodiment, a digital audio processor (DAA) receives as input a compressed digital signal representing an original signal, a noise signal, and a time-varying signal indicative of signal values between the original signal and the noise signal. The DAA generates as output a compressed digital signal representative of a residual signal by: (1) dividing the digital signal by the time-varying signal to obtain a first time series and a second time series, (2) selecting a value from each of the first and second time series, (3) selecting between every selected value of the first time series and the second time series a value that may be a linear combination of the values selected from the first time series and the first time series, (4) selecting between every selected value of the second time series and the first time series a value that may be a linear combination of the values selected from the second time series and the second time series, and (5) applying a linear combination of the values selected from the first time series and the values selected from the second time series in order to generate the compressed digital signal.
(actual abstract) A new framework for video compressed sensing models the evolution of the image frames of a video sequence as a linear dynamical system (LDS). This reduces the video recovery problem to first estimating the model parameters of the LDS from compressive measurements, from which the image frames are then reconstructed. We exploit the low-dimensional dynamic parameters (state sequence) and high-dimensional static parameters (observation matrix) of the LDS to devise a novel compressive measurement strategy that measures only the dynamic part of the scene at each instant and accumulates measurements over time to estimate the static parameters. This enables us to lower the compressive measurement rate considerably yet obtain video recovery at a high frame rate that is in fact inversely proportional to the length of the video sequence. This property makes our framework well-suited for high-speed video capture and other applications. We validate our approach with a range of experiments including classification experiments that highlight the purposive nature of our framework.
(title)
Method and apparatus for compressive acquisition and recovery of dynamic imagery

rouge-2:	P:  3.72	R:  4.88	F1:  4.22
