(predicted abstract) A process and system for producing a dried fermenting ethanol product from an aqueous fermentation broth. The product, which has a reduced number of residual solids, is collected and dried to obtain the desired ethanol content. A portion of the dried fermentation product is extracted with an organic liquid extraction medium, resulting in the production of aqueous ethanol and a low solids fraction. The low solids fraction is concentrated with an organic phase comprising alcohol solvents to form a first ethanol product. The organic phase is collected and used as a first solids extraction medium to produce an aqueous ethanol product which is extracted to form a second solids extraction medium. The second solids fraction is separated from the aqueous ethanol product to obtain the second solids fraction. The second solids fraction is used as a second solids extraction medium to extract solids therefrom to form an aqueous ethanol product. The aqueous ethanol product is separated from the high solids fraction and, together with the low solids fraction, is subjected to a solubilization process to form the aqueous fermentation broth.
(actual abstract) A dry grind ethanol production process and system with front end milling method is provided for improving alcohol and/or by-product yields, such as oil and/or protein yields. In one example, the process includes grinding corn kernels into particles then mixing the corn particles with a liquid to produce a slurry including oil, protein, starch, fiber, germ, and grit. Thereafter, the slurry is subjected to a front end milling method, which includes separating the slurry into a solids portion, including fiber, grit, and germ, and a liquid portion, including oil, protein, and starch, then milling the separated solids portion to reduce the size of the germ and grit and release bound starch, oil, and protein from the solids portion. The starch is converted to sugar, and alcohol is produced therefrom then recovered. Also, the fiber can be separated and recovered. Oil and protein may be separated and recovered as well.

(predicted abstract) The present invention provides an assembly having an electrically heated showerhead in which hot air from the showerhead is passed into a plenum between two heat insulating plates. The hot air from the plenum is then passed to the ambient orifice without the hot air heating the showerhead. The heat insulating plates are made from a material that provides a minimal amount of insulating material and, therefore, a minimal amount of heat to the hot air passing to the showerhead.
(actual abstract) The present disclosure generally comprises a heated showerhead assembly that may be used to supply processing gases into a processing chamber. The processing chamber may be an etching chamber. When processing gas is evacuated from the processing chamber, the uniform processing of the substrate may be difficult. As the processing gas is pulled away from the substrate and towards the vacuum pump, the plasma, in the case of etching, may not be uniform across the substrate. Uneven plasma may lead to uneven etching. To prevent uneven etching, the showerhead assembly may be separated into two zones each having independently controllable gas introduction and temperature control. The first zone corresponds to the perimeter of the substrate while the second zone corresponds to the center of the substrate. By independently controlling the temperature and the gas flow through the showerhead zones, etching uniformity of the substrate may be increased.
(title)
Heated showerhead assembly

It is preferable that the oxide coating includes a metal compound of one kind selected from the group consisting of MgO, SiO<sub>2</sub>, CaO, SrO, BaO, MnO, ZnO, Y<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3 </sub>and Ta<sub>2</sub>O<sub>5</sub>. It is preferable that the magnetic powder can further include a metal compound film formed of one kind selected from the group consisting of Co, Pd, In, Al, Cu, Al, and Cr.
(actual abstract) An aspect of the present invention relates to magnetic powder, which is magnetoplumbite hexagonal strontium ferrite magnetic powder comprising 0.05 atomic percent to 3 atomic percent of Ca per 100 atomic percent of Fe, but comprising no rare earth elements or transition metal elements other than Fe, the average particle size of which ranges from 10 nm to 25 nm, and which is magnetic powder for magnetic recording.

The method includes a first step of (1) mixing a first raw material and a second raw material to obtain a precipitate, the first raw material being a solution containing a zirconium carbonate complex and having a pH of at least 7.0 and not more than 9.5, and the second raw material containing a compound containing the above element M<sup>1 </sup>as a constituent element; and (2) a second step of mixing the precipitate and a third raw material containing Li as a constituent element to obtain a mixture, and then firing the mixture at a temperature of less than 1,000&#xb0; C. to obtain a fired product. The first raw material is prepared by mixing, at a prescribed molar ratio, at least a compound that contains a carbonate species and a compound that contains a zirconium species.

(predicted abstract) A method for generating a linear composite map representation of a desired geographical area which includes generating a plurality of linear elements on a computer. Each linear element has one or more corresponding map elements. The linear elements are assigned to data areas which are of the desired geographical area. The map elements are assigned to data regions of the desired geographical area. A user of the computer selects data areas based on the selected map elements by selecting a predetermined number of linear elements. The predetermined number of linear elements is the minimum number of linear elements required to be included by an original map representation of the selected data areas. The predetermined number of data areas is selected from a table based on the selected data areas. The linear elements include those of a type selected from a list of types including straight ahead, point of origin, or a combination of straight ahead and point of origin with the other types of linear elements. The electronic pill (<b>102</b>) comprises a mechanism (<b>114</b>) for changing, upon actuation, from a constraining configuration in which the piston (<b>110</b>) is maintained at its constrained position to a releasing configuration in which the piston (<b>110</b>) is released. (predicted abstract) A stainless steel sheet for a separator for a solid polymer fuel cell has a stainless steel core plate. At least one resin impregnation layer is provided on the surface of the stainless steel core plate. In a solid polymer fuel cell incorporating the separator, the resin impregnation layer on the surface of the stainless steel core plate provides good adhesion between the separator and the cell, and prevents thermal stress in the separator and the cell from being caused when the cell is heated after discharging fuel. This enables the separator to maintain a predetermined thermal resistance while suppressing thermal stress in the separator and the cell by limiting thermal expansion and contraction of the separator and the cell. When the cell is cooled after discharging fuel, the temperature of the separator may be maintained at a temperature of 120.degree. C. to 200.degree. C. within 10 minutes in a state that the separator is provided with an impregnation layer.
(actual abstract) A stainless steel member for a separator of a solid polymer fuel cell has excellent cell properties with little deterioration in performance over long periods of operation without worsening of the corrosion resistance of a stainless steel separator. The electrically conductive precipitate penetrates the passive film and includes a substance originating from the stainless steel base metal. An electrically conductive layer comprising a nonmetallic electrically conductive substance is preferably provided on the surface of the passive film, and the electrically conductive layer is preferably electrically connected to the stainless steel base member through the electrically conductive precipitates.

(actual abstract) A simulator for a switched electronic power converter circuit feeding a load/device uses a modified FAMNM solver. Provided is a method/system for reducing/eliminating spurious power losses and transients inherently caused by the FAMNM solver using an L/C element approach, wherein a switching device in the &#x2018;on&#x2019; state is featured as an inductor L, and a switching device that is in the &#x2018;off&#x2019; state is featured as either a capacitance C or series-connected resistance and capacitance R-C. The invention uses cross-initialization of the L/C switching elements to their final state of current and voltage when they change their conduction state. The correct cross-initialization is enabled from optional pre-stored tables of events and the system-states at the time of the cross-initialization. The inventive method is an enhancement over known Dommel and Pejovic type FAMNM solvers. The simulator applies to real-time or non-real time simulators and is suitable for all power converter topologies.

The DMA controller selects a single search key from the set and generates a lookup command message that is communicated to the ILA interface circuit. The ILA interface circuit generates an ILA packet that includes the single search key and sends the ILA packet to an external transactional memory device that generates a result data value. The result data value is communicated back to the DMA controller via the ILA interface circuit. The DMA controller stores the result data value in the shared memory and notifies the processor that the DMA process has completed.

(predicted abstract) A wire arc spray thermal spraying process is provided for forming metallic structures (e.g. wires) having high thermal conductance and good corrosion resistance. The process uses high energy current in combination with pulsed flow, resulting in a significant improvement in high energy temperature at which the metallic structure can be formed. An apparatus for implementing the process and a method for forming a metallic article are also disclosed. The apparatus includes an arc chamber configured to contain an arc to melt the metal and cause the formation of the metallic article. The apparatus additionally includes at least one nozzle having a flow channel disposed proximate the arc chamber, wherein the flow channel is configured to allow the molten metal to flow out of the chamber in a substantially vertical path, thereby forming an arc. The at least one nozzle preferably includes one or more of a nozzle having an inner surface comprising a thermally reflective material and/or an outer surface comprising a thermally conductive material. The outer surface is preferably configured to direct the molten metal substantially vertically in the vertical direction, and is preferably configured to direct the molten metal substantially vertically in the horizontal direction. The apparatus may further include a heater for thermally decomposing the molten metal as it flows out of the chamber. The apparatus is particularly useful in forming wires having high ductility by using thermally inert materials such as tungsten, molybdenum and zirconium.
(actual abstract) A wire arc spray system (<b>100</b>) includes a plurality of arc spray subsystems (<b>130</b>) mounted to a movable carriage (<b>120</b>) on an x-y robot (<b>110</b>). Each arc spray subsystem includes a wire drive (<b>132</b>) that provides wire (<b>133, 134</b>) to a spray head (<b>138</b>) through a pair of lead cables (<b>136</b>). The spray heads are mounted for circular motion, such that the molten spray is applied to an underlying substrate in a swirling pattern. In one embodiment, the spray heads are mounted to a distal end of a rod (<b>164</b>) that extends through a swivel ball joint (<b>166</b>) and engages an eccentric link (<b>162</b>) fixed to a motor (<b>160</b>). The system applies an overlapping pattern of molten spray to provide excellent non-skid and adhesion properties. The system is particularly suited to spray coating with a wire comprising a hollow metallic portion and a core having ceramic particles.
(title)

A second signal is received on a second of the plurality of different frequency channels, both the first signal and the second signal being received on first and second different base stations, respectively. The method includes determining a timing difference between the first signal and the second signal, the timing difference including a time difference that is a function of a time difference between receipt of the first signal and receipt of the second signal and a time at which a given signal that was encoded at the first of the plurality of different frequency channels is to be received on the second of the plurality of different frequency channels in order to reconstruct the second signal from the first signal. The method includes synchronizing a receiver in the signal reception path by selecting a first frequency channel of the plurality of different frequency channels at which to receive the second signal, the first frequency channel being used on which to receive the first signal, and determining that the first frequency channel is not in use by measuring the timing difference.
(actual abstract) A filter bank multi-carrier (FBMC) receiver implementing a synchronization in the frequency domain. The receiver includes a synchronization module including an error estimator on the sampling instants and, for each subcarrier, an interpolating filter for reconstructing the samples at the accurate sampling instants. A phase-shifter is provided, for each subcarrier, at the output of the interpolating filter, to make a phase compensation. The phase-shifter can be followed by an equalizer in the frequency domain.

(predicted abstract) " A method for cleaving a substrate, including the steps of (1) obtaining a substrate having a cleave region and at least one cleave region layer overlying the surface of the substrate; (2) subjecting the substrate to thermal strain; (3) causing the substrate in the cleave region to exhibit a tensile yield stress at least 10 percent greater than a conventional ""cisper "", where the cisper is defined as the difference in (i) the tensile stress at a depth of a cleave region layer from the surface of the substrate at which that layer occurs and (ii) a tensile stress at a depth from the surface of the substrate at which that layer occurs; and (4) subjecting the cleave region to a mechanical stress whereby at least one portion of the cleave region layer is selectively cleaved. The method can be implemented by exposing the substrate to an ultraviolet light beam and a mechanical stress to separate away the cleave region. Preferably, the mechanical stress is applied using ultrasonic or hydraulic energy which has a frequency in a range of about 0.01 to 0.1 MHz. The substrate can comprise silicon, germanium, or III-V materials, including silicon or germanium alloy materials. By virtue thereof, the cleaving method of the invention can be implemented to selectively remove at least a portion of a cleave region layer, for example, for the formation of a quantum well within a device. "
(actual abstract) A thickness of material may be detached from a substrate along a cleave plane, utilizing a cleaving process controlled by a releasable constraint plate. In some embodiments this constraint plate may comprise a plate that can couple side forces (the &#x201c;P-plate&#x201d;) and a thin, softer compliant layer (the &#x201c;S-layer&#x201d;) situated between the P-plate and the substrate. In certain embodiments a porous surface within the releasable constraint plate and in contact to the substrate, allows the constraint plate to be secured to the substrate via a first pressure differential. Application of a combination of a second pressure differential within a pre-existing cleaved portion, and a linear force to a side of the releasable constraint plate bound to the substrate, generates loading that results in controlled cleaving along the cleave plane.
(title)

The first friction clutches connect the respective drive shaft to the first sub-transmission. The second friction clutches connect the respective drive shaft to the second sub-transmission. The first friction clutches and the second friction clutches form the power-splitting device.

The synthetic antibody is particularly well suited for use in detecting the presence of a variety of disease states, e.g., a disease state in which the disease is associated with increased free form of ferroportin, such as atherosclerosis, atherosclerosis related nephritis, angiogenesis, nephropathy, atherosclerosis and rheumatoid arthritis. The synthetic antibody may also be used in a kit which uses the synthetic antibody in an assay for detecting one or more of the immuno-active agents. The antibodies which may be used in the kit may also be used in diagnostic assays to determine the presence of one or more of the immuno-active agents in a test sample. Furthermore, the use of the synthetic antibody for detecting an increase in the serum free form of ferroportin in a test sample is described.

If, on the other hand, the gaming system receives the second fold input from the player, the gaming system folds the player's hand and does not remove the player from the virtual table.

(predicted abstract) A method of manufacturing an electronic package system for use in electrically connecting a microelectronic device to a package substrate is provided. First, a dielectric material is deposited on the package substrate. The via defines a contact region of a wire bond connected to the first trace. A dielectric film is deposited on the dielectric material around the via in such a way that the dielectric film forms a dielectric-defined trace on the insulating material around the via. A second via is then defined in the dielectric material and into the package substrate. A wire bond is inserted in the second via of the dielectric film extending around the insulating-defined trace of the dielectric material. A photo-resist is then deposited on the package substrate, and the photo-resist and package substrate are selectively etched to define a cavity in the package substrate into which the photo-resist and the package substrate are then planarized.

[ 535 ]
(predicted abstract) This is a method for determining if a conditional instruction is a conditional operation, based on the first portion of the operation being determined as conditional, from an instruction having a second portion of the operation being a conditional condition instruction. In operation, a determination is made if the first portion of the instruction equals the second portion of the conditional state. A state machine is used which determines when certain operations that include the first and second portions of the operation, will be dependent upon the state of the first and second operations, respectively. The state machine has a first state associated with the first operation, and a second state associated with the second operation. The state machine switches from the first state to the second state when the second portion of the instruction indicates that the first operation is dependent upon the first operation, and from the second state to the first state when the second portion of the instruction indicates that the second operation is dependent upon the first operation to thereby allow the first operation to be determined with a single state machine. The second state is associated with the second operation when it is determined that the first operation is dependent upon the second operation, and the second state is associated with the first operation when it is determined that the first operation is not dependent upon the second operation. The state engine is used to determine the state of the first operation upon being placed in the first state such that it may also be placed in the first state and in the second state. The end of the operation is not the first instruction, thereby allowing the first operation to be determined with the single state engine.
(actual abstract) A conditional instruction end facility is provided that allows completion of an instruction to be delayed. In executing the machine instruction, an operand is obtained, and a determination is made as to whether the operand has a predetermined relationship with respect to a value. Based on determining that the operand does not have the predetermined relationship with respect to the value, the obtaining and the determining are repeated. Based on determining that the operand has the predetermined relationship with respect to the value, execution of the instruction is completed. The obtaining the operand, the determining whether the operand has the predetermined relationship, the based on determining that the operand does not have the predetermined relationship with respect to the value, repeating the obtaining and the determining, and the based on determining that the operand has the predetermined relationship with respect to the value, completing execution of the instruction are performed as part of a single instruction having one operation code.
(title)
Conditional instruction end operation

The predetermined pressing force can suppress deformation of the work and displacement of the drill due to the machining reaction. The machining reaction and the pressing force are calculated beforehand in a drilling test.

(predicted abstract) A method is provided for performing a common mode noise suppression during vicinity and distance detection of an object. A noise signal and a power detector are provided. The noise signal is detected with the noise detector and the power detector provides an indication of the power in the noise signal. A determination is made of the presence of a proximity to the object based upon the object-related electrical signals. The presence of a proximity is performed by determining whether a first value of the object-related electrical signals is less than a first reference value and determining whether a second value of the object-related electrical signals exceeds a second reference value.
(actual abstract) In one embodiment, a touch sensor includes a touch screen having a plurality of electrodes and a controller. The reference area includes two or more of the plurality of electrodes, and at least one of the electrodes of the reference area is electrically coupled to a voltage reference. The main area includes electrodes of the plurality of electrodes that are not in the reference area.

(predicted abstract) A method and apparatus are described for compensating for the effects of a transmitter in a time-frequency-shifted orthogonal frequency division multiplexed (OFDM) communications system by determining the phase of a training signal and controlling the phase of the transponder of the transmitter to minimize the phase error. By adjusting the transmission phase of the transmitter, the transmission amplitude of the transmitter can be set, which can be optimized, optimized as a function of the transmitter system and/or network parameters. A transmitter with a known transmitter impedance, a transmitter with an actual impedance, and a system incorporating both the transmitter impedance and the actual impedance are described. If the transmitter is a transmitter capable of transmitting information on a plurality of different frequencies with different transmission amplitudes are known, a transmitter impedance value and a receiver impedance value may be determined for each of the plurality of different frequencies. The transmission value may be determined as a product of the source impedance value and this known and actual impedance values. In such case, the transmission waveform is configured as a first-order square-wave pulse. However, if the transmitter is a transmitter capable of transmitting information across a plurality of different frequencies with different transmission amplitudes, a transmitter impedance value and a receiver impedance value are determined. The transmission waveform may be configured as a first-order square-wave pulse of a fixed-amplitude and a different frequency than the known and actual impedance values. However, if the transmitter is capable of transmitting information across a plurality of different frequencies, a fixed-amplitude, fixed-impedance, zero-impedance-frequency modulation may be utilized.
(actual abstract) A method for modulating data for transmission within a communication system. The method further includes combining the time-frequency shifting matrix with a data frame to provide an intermediate data frame. A transformed data matrix is provided by permuting elements of the intermediate data frame. A modulated signal is generated in accordance with elements of the transformed data matrix.

(actual abstract) An audio matrix formed from absolute amplitude values of coefficients obtained by frequency-transforming an audio signal is generated. Bases concerning the target sound are obtained from the bases concerning the noise classified from the basis spectrum matrix. A matrix including frequency amplitude values of the target sound is obtained using the bases concerning the target sound classified from the basis spectrum matrix, the bases concerning the target sound and noise classified from the activity matrix, and the obtained bases. The audio signal of the target sound is generated using the matrix.

(actual abstract) An LED lamp includes a rectifier, an integrated circuit and a string of series-connected LEDs. The lamp receives an incoming AC signal such that a rectified version of the signal is present across the LED string. The integrated circuit includes a plurality of power switches. Each power switch is coupled so that it can separately and selectably short out a corresponding one of several groups of LEDs in the string. As the voltage across the string increases the integrated circuit controls the power switches such that the number of LEDs through which current flows increases, whereas as the voltage across the string decreases the integrated circuit controls the power switches such that the number of LEDs through which current flows decreases. LED string current flow is controlled and regulated to provide superior efficiency, reliability, anti-flicker, regulation against line voltage variations, power factor correction, and lamp over-voltage, over-current, and over-temperature protection.
(title)

The differential includes a left clutch pack that prevents relative rotation between the left clutch actuator and the left axle hub about the axis of rotation when a left clutch engagement pressure is applied to the left clutch pack and a right clutch pack that prevents relative rotation between the right clutch actuator and the right axle hub about the axis of rotation when a right clutch engagement pressure is applied to the right clutch pack. A rotation limiting arrangement at the inboard sides of the left and right clutch actuators is provided for limiting relative rotation between the left and right clutch actuators about the axis of rotation. The rotation limiting arrangement includes a rotation limiter captured between first and second stop surfaces which cooperate to define a limited range of relative rotational movement between the left and right clutch actuators. The rotation limiter has a first location that makes line contact with the first stop surface. The rotation limiter also has a second location that makes line contact with the second stop surface.

(predicted abstract) An application-level system for speech recognition is presented which enables recognition of partial proper names in spoken input. The application-level system includes a speech recognizer that is configured to perform speech recognition on input speech to identify partial proper names. The application-level system includes a partial proper name engine that is operable to receive a series of input speech and is configured to convert this series of input speech into a series of partial proper names. During use, the partial proper names are presented in the application-level system and are responsive to a series of commands. In one example of speech recognition application-level systems in which the partial proper-address recognition performed by the speech recognizer is responsive to input speech only, the application-level system includes a speech recognition engine which is configured to perform speech recognition upon the input speech and to convert the input speech into a series of partial proper names from the series of input speech. After recognition, the partial proper-address recognition performed on the partial proper names is responsive to both the input speech and to the command-based command.
(actual abstract) A method for speech recognition of partial proper names is described which includes natural language processing (NLP), partial name candidate generation, speech recognition and post processing. Natural language processing techniques including shallow and deep parsing are applied to long proper names to identify syntactic units (for example, noun phrases). The syntactic units form a basis for generating a candidate list of partial names for each original full name. A partial name is part of the original name, with some words omitted, or word order changed, or even word substitution. After candidate partial names are generated, their phonetic transcriptions are incorporated into a model for a speech recognizer to recognize the partial names in a speech recognition system.
(title)
Speech recognition of partial proper names by natural language processing

The image of the surface is captured such that the image of the surface is representative of the pattern of the surface as measured by an optical system of the laser beam generator which is positioned on the surface being measured such that the image of the surface is projected such that portions of the surface are within the field of view of the optical system. One method for calibrating laser pulses from a laser eye surgery system using an image capture device comprises imaging a known object with an image capture device. A pulsed laser beam is directed onto a calibration surface so as to leave a mark on the calibration surface. The mark on the calibration surface is then imaged with the image capture device. The laser eye surgery system is calibrated by comparing the image of the mark on the calibration surface to the image of the known object.

The frequency-domain image includes the set of frequency bins and sets of ranges. [ 624 ]
(predicted abstract) A thermal expansion valve is provided with an electromagnetic actuator. One end portion of the actuator is held so as to be displaceable in a cylinder through a diaphragm and the other end portion is held so as not to be displaceable by means of a rod. A diaphragm is formed in the cylinder so as to have a greater thickness than a thickness of the rod. The rod is made of a magnetic material so as to be displaceable in the cylinder according to a change of a magnetic field generated by an electromagnet. When the rod is displaced, the diaphragm is displaced so that heat in a heat exchange tube is not applied to the actuator. When the rod is not displaced, the electromagnet is not energized. Therefore, when an external force is applied to one end portion of the actuator, the other end portion of the actuator is displaced, thereby opening a valve.
(actual abstract) A thermal expansion valve with one-way control function includes a valve body having an inlet passage and an out passage, a temperature sensor installed on one end of the valve body, and a first valve core component installed in an inside chamber of the valve body. The first valve core component includes a first valve core and a valve rod against the temperature sensor. The valve body also includes an accommodation component extending from said the inlet passage into the valve body and coaxially installed with the inlet passage. The accommodation component has a second valve port connected with the inside chamber. The accommodation component has a second valve core component having a supporting piece and a second valve core matching the second valve port. The processing of the structure is convenient and the assembly of the second valve core component is simple and reliable.
(title)

(predicted abstract) A method of manufacturing a display device is disclosed. (actual abstract) An object is to reduce power consumption of a display device and to suppress deterioration of display quality. As a transistor provided for each pixel, a transistor including an oxide semiconductor layer is used. Note that off-state current of the transistor can be decreased when the oxide semiconductor layer is highly purified. Therefore, variation in the value of a data signal due to the off-state current of the transistor can be suppressed. That is, display deterioration (change) which occurs when writing frequency of the data signal to the pixel including the transistor is reduced (when a break period is lengthened) can be suppressed. In addition, flickers in display which generates when the frequency of an alternating-current driving signal supplied to a signal line in the break period is reduced can be suppressed.
(title)
Display device and driving method

rouge-3:	P:  0.88	R:  0.75	F1:  0.81
rouge-4:	P:  0.00	R:  0.00	F1:  0.00

(predicted abstract) A system for position multiple-point scintillation detection (PSDD) is provided. An optical encoder includes: a photodetector for producing an electrical signal in response to the detection of photons; one or more optical components responsive to light and coupled to the photodetector. The optical components produce one or more optical outputs which each corresponds to one or more of the photons incident on the photodetector and in response to which are produced the electrical signal. The electrical signal is encoded in the electrical signal. An optical guide for directing optical signal includes one or more light source that each produces light energy at a particular wavelength and wherein an optical guide assembly directs the light energy produced by each source into a single optical guide coupled to the optical encoder such that at least one of the at least one of the optical outputs is detected or emitted from the optical guide through at least one or more of the one or more optical components.
(actual abstract) Various embodiments are described herein for a radiation dosimetry apparatus and associated methods for measuring radiation dose. In some embodiments, the apparatus includes multiple scintillating elements for detecting amounts of radiation dose at multiple points within a detection region. Each of the scintillating elements generates light in response to radiation interacting within their volume. A light guide combines the light generated by all of the scintillating elements as well as radiation-induced contaminated optical energy and transmits the combined light to a spectral analysis setup. Multi or hyper-spectral calibration technique allows calculating the dose or dose rate at the positions of the different scintillating elements. The calibration technique isolates the light produced by a given scintillating element from the other scintillating elements as well as any other source of radiation-induced contaminating light.

(predicted abstract) A wireless positioning system comprises a positioning apparatus and a base station communicatively arranged with the positioning apparatus when the positioning apparatus is activated. The control circuit adjusts the frequency of the positioning clock by using the correction value. A search for a matching patch may be focused in a region that is determined based at least in part on an estimate of movement of the point between images. Points may be tracked across multiple images. If an ability to track one or more points is lost, information about the points being tracked may be used to relocate the points in another image.

(predicted abstract) A metal gate stack including a plurality of high-k layers separated by an insulating layer formed on a substrate. A thin gate dielectric layer is formed on the insulating layer. The second contact metal layer is formed on the second surface of the substrate. A contact via is formed with a second thickness greater than the first thickness and located in the insulating layer below a portion of the first contact metal layer. A metal-insulator-metal (MIM) barrier is formed between the first conductive layer and the second contact metal layer to form self-aligned contact between the first conductive layer and the second contact metal layer. A method of forming a LDMOS transistor is also disclosed including the following steps: forming a first dielectric layer on a substrate; forming a conductive layer by partially removing the first dielectric layer to expose an upper portion of the conductive layer; removing the conductive layer by planarization; forming a second dielectric layer; forming a conductive gate by partially removing the second dielectric layer; forming a protective layer on the conductive gate and the second dielectric layer; and forming first contact metal layers.

The embedded etch stop layer may make the removal of replacement metal gate layers easier and more controllable, providing horizontal surfaces and determined depths to serve as the base for gate cap formation. [ 660 ]
(predicted abstract) Systems and methods for categorizing motion events are disclosed. In one embodiment, a method for categorizing motion events received by a computing device may include the following steps. A motion event in a first sequence of motion events is received by the computing device. The computing device analyzes the first sequence of motion events in order to identify if an event sequence is present relative to a set of movement sequences. If an event sequence is present, the computing device selects a movement sequence from the set of movement sequences. If no movement sequence is present, the computing device selects a different movement sequence from the set of movement sequences and analyzes the second sequence of motion events to identify if an event sequence is present in the second sequence of motion events when compared to the different movement sequence. Thus, a categorization of motion events may be generated by the computing device and used for selecting a user interface for display on the computing device.
(actual abstract) The various embodiments described herein include methods, devices, and systems for categorizing motion events. In one aspect, a method includes: (1) obtaining a plurality of video frames, the plurality of video frames corresponding to a scene and a motion event candidate; (2) identifying one or more visual characteristics of the scene; (3) obtaining one or more background factors for the scene; (4) utilizing the obtained background factors to identify one or more motion entities; (5) for each identified motion entity: (a) classifying the motion entity by performing object recognition; and (b) obtaining one or more representative motion vectors based on a motion track of the motion entity; and (6) assigning a motion event category to the motion event candidate based on the identified visual characteristics, the obtained background factors, the classified motion entities, and the obtained representative motion vectors.
(title)
Systems and methods for categorizing motion events

[ 661 ]
(predicted abstract) A metal silicide capacitor and method of fabricating the same. An oxide layer is formed on a substrate. A polysilicon layer is formed on the oxide layer such that the poly-silicon layer has a thickness of less than 50 .ANG.. A metal layer is deposited over the poly-silicon layer. This metal layer forms a metal silicide layer. The metal silicide layer and the polysilicon layer are patterned to form a poly-silicon plate of a cell capacitor. The metal layer and the oxide layer are etched to remove the poly-silicon plate thereby forming a plurality of openings to the oxide layer between the metal layer and the poly-silicon plate. The metal layer is subjected to a heat treatment to partially form silicide from the metal silicide layer. Each of the metal silicide layers remains within a respective opening to form a capacitor plate. The capacitor plate is separated from the substrate.
(actual abstract) A method includes forming a trench in a Silicon substrate; depositing metal on sidewalls and a bottom of the trench; annealing to react the metal with underlying Si and form metal silicide adjacent to sidewalls and bottom of the trench; removing unreacted metal and depositing a dielectric layer on the metal silicide, a metal layer over the dielectric layer and polysilicon to fill a remainder of the trench thereby forming top plate electrode of a MIM capacitor. The method further forms a transistor adjacent to a top of the trench, where the transistor is connected to the top plate electrode of the MIM capacitor via a strap interface that comprises a portion of the metal silicide layer at the top of the trench. The portion of the metal silicide layer can be disposed in an SOI layer, and silicide in the Si substrate forms a bottom plate of the capacitor.
(title)
Integrated circuit having MIM capacitor with refractory metal silicided strap and method to fabricate same

(predicted abstract) " In a method for zero traffic hit synchronization switchover in a telecommunication network, the time intervals at which the call for two or more telecommunication subscribers that are currently active on the same line, when one of them is activated, are compared to zero to determine whether the call should be switched on from a first telecommunication subscriber to a second telephone subscriber during this time interval, or from the second subscriber into a third telecommunication subscriber. In this case, only one of the first and second telecommunication subscribers is required to be assigned the time interval of activation, which allows for the start of switching to be performed without an excessive ""override"" time or of a delay period to take place on the telephone lines, so that one of the subscribers whose telecommunication is available to be switched by a switching function does not have to be switched over. "
(actual abstract) Embodiments of the present disclosure relate to a Zero traffic hit synchronization switch over technique in a telecommunication network. The switch over is carried out by switching input reference of the receiver from one or more master (<b>1</b>) to at least one slave (<b>2</b>), wherein said slave (<b>2</b>) becomes new master (<b>2</b>) and said one or more master (<b>1</b>) becomes new slave (<b>1</b>) after switching. Now, the new master (<b>2</b>) locks to the new slave (<b>1</b>) for predetermined time period. Once the predetermined is elapsed, the new master (<b>2</b>) is disconnected from the new slave (<b>1</b>), wherein said new master (<b>2</b>) selects its own network reference clock upon disconnection of the new slave (<b>1</b>). The new slave (<b>1</b>) is locked to the new master (<b>2</b>) to synchronize the switchover in redundant systems.
(title)
Method for zero traffic hit synchronization switchover in telecommunication network

(actual abstract) A ball dropper has a stack of trays that have solid portions for supporting a ball and open portions to allow a ball to pass through a tray. Fixed barriers limit the travel of the ball with the rotating tray to allow the ball to become unsupported so that it can be caught on the tray below. A stepper motor precisely makes the required incremental rotation to allow the addition of the next ball at the top. Once the trays are filled or the balls loaded are advanced such that the lead ball is on the last tray any further rotation will start to discharge the balls with each increment of rotation. The device is easy and cheap to fabricate and presents a reliable way to get jam free operation while having a housing that will tolerate the operating pressures in the wellbore.

(predicted abstract) A device for detecting and discriminating the particles of a flow of particles contained in a measuring medium, wherein a sample, which can be passed through a measuring zone for a specific particles of a flow of particles, is introduced into a measuring chamber, at least in parts, and separated in two separator portions. The separated particles in each separator portion travel along with the medium in a predetermined flow direction and are caused to exit the respective separator portion from the measuring chamber, are further separated by a particle-particle separator arranged at the end section of each separator portion such that the separated particles of the flow are separated from the particle mixture in the particle separator in accordance with their particle size in such a way that no particles of the mixture exist in the measuring chamber, and a flow of particles in each separator portion, which corresponds to a particle of the sample, is analyzed in order to distinguish the particles of the sample and to produce signals corresponding to the particles of the sample present in the measuring chamber from signals corresponding to the particles of the sample present in the flow of particles. The device includes a particle sensor disposed between the two separator portions. The particle sensor comprises an emitter portion, and a receiver portion disposed behind the emitter portion in the flow direction. Both the emitter portion and receiver portion are disposed in such a manner as to allow detection of particles of the sample while not allowing detection of particles of the particle mixture, wherein the emitter portion and the receiver portion are spaced from one another along the predetermined flow direction. The emitter portion is arranged such that after detecting particles of the sample by the receiver portion, particles of the sample are detected by the emitter portion and the particles are converted into signals which define the particle size of the sample.

(actual abstract) A state space feedback controller operates in the digital domain for the regulation of the current supply to MRI gradient coils from a multiple-bridge PWM power amplifier. The P1-controller includes an integration part (for the integration of the difference between the demand current and the measured gradient coil current) and a subsequent P-controlled system which in turn includes a delay compensator/stabilizer and a plant. The delay compensator/stabilizer includes a multi-path feedback loop by means of which its digital output signal is fed back through delay blocks, on the one hand, and through filter units, on the other hand. The filter units model the transfer functions of a gradient coil output filter for the gradient coil voltage and the output current of the amplifier inverter units, respectively. In the plant, a filter unit, which models the gradient coil transfer function, is connected in series to a delay chain for the delay of the measurement value of the gradient coil current.

A slide lock, mounted on the barrel for longitudinal movement therein between a forward, extended position and a rear, retracted position, locks a rearward portion of the bore against a rearward portion of the handle. To change the barrel between the open and closed positions, the handle and barrel are moved from the open position to the closed position and the slide lock is moved inwardly from the forward extended position to the rear, retracted position. The barrel and handle are then held in their open position by the slide lock.

The reaction occurs at a temperature of about 300&deg; C. to about 500&deg; C. and at a pressure less than about 10 psi. The process gas, such as steam, is fed into the fluidized bed in one or more stages wherein the gas is fed into the reactor through a tube having an interior wall that defines an inner fluid flow chamber and wherein the inner fluid flow chamber is filled with a high density polymer filler composition. A heat transfer element is used to transfer heat between the feedstock and the process gas. [ 696 ]
(predicted abstract) A power supply control apparatus and system which utilizes a non-conducting contactless power supply for controlling a vehicle-mounted apparatus and can improve safety. The power supply control apparatus has a power supply circuit for controlling a switching element of the power supply circuit by performing an on/off control of the switching element. When a voltage supply condition of a power supply of the vehicle does not satisfy an on/off signal outputted from the power supply system to the power supply circuit, the on/off control of the switching element is performed in an off period of the switching element, and the power supply condition is held even after an off period. Thus, when a voltage supply of the power supply circuit does not satisfy the on/off signal, an on/off control is performed when the voltage of the power supply circuit is reduced to a level below the voltage of the power supply. Thus, the power supply control apparatus can prevent an erroneous detection by an on/off signal while maintaining a constant voltage supply, thereby reducing energy consumption and preventing an electric shock of an electric load, of the power supply system.
(actual abstract) A power supply control apparatus is connected to an electric device to control supply of power to the electric device. The apparatus includes a main power switch to apply or interrupt main power to the electric device, the main power being external input commercial AC power, an auxiliary power storage unit supplied and charged with the main power as auxiliary power, a charging/discharging unit including a charging circuit to convert the main power into DC power and charge the converted DC power in the auxiliary power storage unit, and a discharging circuit to convert the DC power in the auxiliary power storage unit into AC power and discharge the converted AC power to the electric device, and a controller to control the main power switch, and control the charging/discharging unit to selectively drive the charging circuit or the discharging circuit.
(title)
Power supply control apparatus and power supply control system having the same

The waveguide element and optical waveguides are bonded to the first surface of the substrate such that the opto-electrical devices are in alignment with optical transceivers and the electronic control and communications elements are aligned with each other. A silicon waveguide for connecting optical transceivers with the opto-electrical devices is attached to the first surface of the substrate over the optical waveguides.
(actual abstract) A multi-chip module (MCM) includes: an interposer, a photonic chip, an optical gain chip, and a waveguide-fiber connector. The photonic chip, which may be electrically coupled to the interposer, may be implemented using a silicon-on-insulator (SOI) technology, and may include an optical waveguide that conveys an optical signal. Moreover, the optical gain chip, which may be electrically coupled to the interposer, may include a III-V compound semiconductor, and may include a second optical waveguide that conveys the optical signal and that is vertically aligned with the optical waveguide relative to a top surface of the interposer. Furthermore, the waveguide-fiber connector may be mechanically coupled to the interposer, and remateably mechanically coupled to an optical fiber coupler that includes the optical fiber. The waveguide-fiber connector may convey the optical signal between the optical waveguide in the photonic chip and the optical fiber.
(title)
Hybrid integrated MCM with waveguide-fiber connector

Such signals may be transmitted by one or more base stations (e.g., cell location base stations, BSC) for cell location reporting, and/or may be transmitted through a mobile network by one or more mobile stations (e.g., base station controllers) for cell location reporting. The cell location reporting may be performed at an edge of a mobile network such as the Internet.

The method also includes calculating a UE metric based on the received signal quality measurements of a plurality of interfering cells and based on a scaling parameter. The method further includes comparing the calculated UE metric to a threshold to determine whether to send the measurement report to the serving cell.

[ 708 ]
(predicted abstract) A method for the electrophoresis for measuring and controlling the concentration of polymeric materials that are used in a cell or in a sample of a sample solution is provided. The method comprises placing one or more conductive polymers into a gel matrix, wherein said conductive polymers have a pH that is different than the pH of a test solution. The conductive polymers are placed into the gel matrix or the sample solution in the sample chamber that can be made to rest on the gel matrix. Polymers are drawn into the test chamber and the test solution is introduced into the test chamber. The gel matrix is then placed into a chamber or sample chamber and said polymers are eluted. The elution and electrophoresis are repeated at various times during a single electrophoresis cycle. The method can determine the concentration of the polymeric materials in a sample. Additionally, an apparatus for the electrophoresis is provided.
(actual abstract) A precast gel and blotting membrane combination unit and method of use. The device includes two plates, each plate having a conductive opaque region with conductive polymers and a transparent region having static-dissipative polymers. Between the plates are a gel matrix and blotting membrane. The device is placed in a tank capable of both performing the electrophoresis phase and transfer phase of a western blot. During the electrophoresis phase, current flows from a pair of electrophoresis electrodes to separate proteins by size. The user can visualize the extent of protein separation by observing a tracking dye through the transparent region. After the electrophoresis phase, voltage is switched to a pair of transfer phase electrodes. The device allows current to flow through the conductive opaque regions of the plates to transfer separated proteins to a blotting membrane directly after electrophoresis without having to remove or reorient the device in the tank.
(title)
Gel electrophoresis and transfer combination using conductive polymers and method of use

The first adhesive is allowed to dry on the first portion of the mold section, and the second adhesive is allowed to dry on the second portion of the mold section. The first and second molds are assembled to form the mold. The mold is then pressurized and the first and second molds are joined into the desired shape, forming a silicone rubber cupping appliance.

(predicted abstract) An energy saving elevator, such as a motor vehicle, is described with an energy saving mechanism for lowering and raising elevator cars to a higher power level in response to changes in the load conditions and in the conditions experienced by the cars. The energy saving mechanism includes a load sensor and a elevator car force control assembly responsive to the output of the load sensor to lower and raise the car by different amounts to compensate for energy consumption by the cars. The apparatus also includes an energy storage device and a control system for maintaining the energy storage device at the highest energy storage level, thus improving energy efficiency. The control system includes an energy sensor for monitoring the energy consumption of the elevator and generating a signal indicative of the result thereof, a load sensor for monitoring the load on the elevator and generating a signal indicative of the result thereof, a motion detector for monitoring the motion of the elevator and generating a signal indicative of the result thereof, and a feedback control system responsive to the load sensor, the load monitor, the motion sensor, the energy sensor, and the energy storage device for generating a signal indicative of the difference between the load on the elevator and the load on the elevator and adjusting the load to the difference.
(actual abstract) The present invention provides a variable mass elevator apparatus and method of operation, wherein the apparatus comprises an electronic scale, an elevator car, a traction sheave, a control computer, a mass storage area, a mass, a mass conveyor, a floor control panel outside of the elevator. When a passenger desires to operate the elevator, the passenger steps on the electronic scale and chooses a floor on the floor control panel, wherein the floor control panel has buttons for each floor. The electronic scale relays the weight of the passenger to the control computer, and the floor control panel relays the desired floor to the control computer. The control computer instructs a mass conveyer to couple a mass corresponding to the weight of the passenger to the elevator cable to act as a counterweight and equalize the potential energy of the elevator according to the desired floor of the passenger and the weight of the passenger.
(title)
Energy saving elevator apparatus with maintaining potential energy by intellectual control variable mass

(predicted abstract) A microprocessor-controlled linear amplifier in which an input signal is converted into an amplified signal using multiple current source circuits, a first voltage detector which measures the input signal, and a second voltage detector which measures a desired voltage. Based on the difference between the measured input signal and the measured desired voltage, an output voltage which is provided to an amplifier and provides an input voltage to the current source circuits is determined. By measuring the input signal and the desired voltage, the required current source circuits are controlled, thereby maintaining the desired voltage within an acceptable tolerance. The output of the current source circuits, which is dependent upon the difference between the input voltage and an output of the linear amplifier, is also used to determine an error associated with components other than the current source circuits. The error is then used to update the target output voltage to compensate for the error. By using this control scheme, more accurate control of the current source circuits is provided, so that the linear amplifier has the effect of increasing the bandwidth without being affected by other than ambient temperature changes.

[ 734 ]
(predicted abstract) " Novel methods for producing supercritical fluids for use in the combustion of hydrocarbon fuels, particularly with the use of supercritical carbon dioxide, are disclosed. In the invention, a mixture of supercritical carbon dioxide and a hydrocarbon fuel is produced. The supercritical carbon dioxide is the first carbon dioxide that is present to form the supercritical fluid. The supercritical carbon dioxide is then heated and the heated carbon dioxide is separated from the hydrocarbon fuel. Both the supercritical and supercritical carbon dioxide are then subjected to pressure to produce a supercritical fluid. The supercritical carbon dioxide and the hydrocarbon fuel are then subjected to cooling with cooling elements thereby lowering the temperature of the supercritical fluid. The cooling elements are selected from the group consisting of direct liquid cooling and means which include cooling tubes, tubes filled with a material having a high heat conductivity and tubes filled with a material having a low heat conductivity. The supercritical fluid is then expanded. The expanded supercritical fluid is then subject to supercritical expansion, thereby producing a supercritical fluid containing less than 5 percent water. A fuel injection unit for use in a supercritical fluid injection system for a combustion vessel includes a pressure vessel formed with a high heat transfer medium, a temperature vessel with heat transfer means for cooling the high heat transfer medium, and a valve for controlling flow of a supercritical fluid from the heat transfer vessel to the pressure vessel, thereby regulating the flow of supercritical fluid from the heat transfer vessel to the pressure vessel. In an alternative method, additional high heat conductivity material such as silicon or diamond is provided in the heat transfer path from the high heat transfer medium to the cooling vessel. The fuel injection unit additionally includes a means for adjusting the flow rate of a supercritical fluid through the heat transfer and cooling units. The means for adjusting the flow rate is selected from the group comprising a valve control device which functions to adjust the flow of carbon dioxide into the valve, an opening control device which functions to adjust the flow of a high heat transfer medium through the valve, and a device for adjusting the position of an opening control plug in the valve. In another method, a liquid is provided to the heat transfer path from the high heat transfer medium to the cooling tubes. The liquid includes a mixture of supercritical carbon dioxide and a hydrocarbon fuel. The liquid is heated to produce a supercritical fluid containing less than 5 percent water. The liquid and the supercritical fluid are then introduced into the heat transfer path from the high heat transfe

[ 735 ]
(predicted abstract) A method and system is disclosed for measuring the electrical capacitance of a semiconductor die and determining the location of die connections without the use of conductive bumps or traces on the die. The die and its surface are connected to a current source. An AC voltage is applied to the connection between the die and the current source. The current source provides a voltage difference between the die and the current source corresponding to the voltage difference between the die and the substrate at the die connection. The voltage difference is measured, recorded, and processed to determine the capacitance. At each time interval the frequency of the voltage difference is periodically varied, and the capacitance values are then calculated. The capacitance values are calculated at periodic intervals and at multiple frequencies and stored as a function of frequency. The method and system provide for measuring the capacitance without placing an additional substrate in the connection, even at times where the substrate was removed from the connection, thereby allowing the measurements to be performed during normal signal applications.
(actual abstract) Systems and methods for determining a capacitance on a device-under-test (&#x201c;DUT&#x201d;). An example implementation includes a voltage signal generator that generates a voltage signal alternating between a high voltage and a low voltage at regular time intervals. The voltage signal generator causes a DUT current to flow in the DUT. The DUT current comprises a leakage current and a capacitance measurement current in response to the voltage signal. A current signal generator receives the DUT current from the DUT. The current signal generator generates a cancellation current signal alternating between high and low values at the regular time intervals of the voltage signal such that the cancellation current signal cancels the leakage current through the DUT. A signal measurement circuit receives the capacitance measurement current remaining after the leakage current is canceled to generate an output voltage having an output voltage value used to determine a capacitance of the DUT.
(title)
System and apparatus for measuring capacitance

rouge-2:	P:  9.04	R: 10.46	F1:  9.70
rouge-3:	P:  1.70	R:  1.97	F1:  1.83

(actual abstract) Methods and systems are disclosed for integrating LC circuits into a user's jewelry for controlling systems such as computer games. The resonant frequency of the circuit at each of multiple rings worn by the user may be adjustable. A secondary coil within each ring may be moved in relation to the magnetic field generated by a primary coil that may be part of another piece of jewelry, such as a watch or a bracelet, to generate control signals. The magnetic field may inductively couple and power the rings, which may each contain an LC tank circuit. If powered, each of these circuits may oscillate at its resonant frequency. A receiver system may comprise an antenna and a tuning circuit to detect a resonant frequency as an input to control moves of a character within a game, for example for use with heads-up displays (HUDs) for augmented reality applications.

By using the photoreceptor's undiffraction-limited area as the SAR portion and using the photoreceptor as the SAR portion, the processor is capable of processing the output signals from the photoreceptor pixels to produce a three-dimensional image.

(predicted abstract) A process of producing a catalyst which comprises the steps of providing a mixture of first particles comprised of crystalline aluminosilicate molecular sieve and crystalline silicoaluminophosphate molecular sieve, in a manner such that the first particles have a volume density less than 5 grams per mole; providing a second mixture comprised of a binder, and a hydrocarbon phase, in a manner such that the second mixture has up to 40 volume percent of the hydrocarbon phase; mixing the first and second mixtures to produce a third mixture; heating the third mixture using a heating means; and adding an organic compound to the third mixture for a sufficient time such that the organic compound is in contact with the third mixture and for a sufficient amount of time to form particles of the hydroprocessing catalyst which have a volume density at least 10 percent greater than the volume density of the first particles with a maximum of 10% of the volume density of the first particles. The particle size distribution of the hydroprocessing catalyst may be further enhanced by the addition of at least one element selected from the group consisting of platinum, palladium, rhodium, iron, cobalt, nickel, copper, ruthenium, rhenium and mixtures thereof in a quantity which is sufficient to enhance both the particle size distribution and the hydroprocessing activity. The invention also provides a process for producing a hydroprocessing catalyst having a density of at least 10 percent greater than the density of the first particles which comprises providing a mixture of crystalline aluminosilicate molecular sieve and crystalline silicoaluminophosphate molecular sieve; providing a binder in a ratio range of from about 1:1 to about 1:2 by weight; adding with the binder at least one hydrocarbon phase to the mixture to form a mixture of first particles, hydrocarbon phase and binder; drying the formed mixture; and adding to the dried mixture an organic compound having a plurality of hydrocarbon molecules in a number ratio range of from about 1:10 to about 1:1 to form a hydroprocessing catalyst having a density of at least 10 percent greater than the density of the first particles.
(actual abstract) A chelated hydroprocessing catalyst exhibiting low moisture is obtained by heating an impregnated, calcined carrier to a temperature higher than 200&#xb0; C. and less than a temperature and for a period of time that would cause substantial decomposition of the chelating agent.

(predicted abstract) A system including a computer having a memory and a processor configured to execute instructions stored in the memory includes a first program module configured to store a set of program instructions, and a second program module configured to determine a timing relationship between a plurality of instructions based on information included in a plurality of instructions. The information may be retrieved from the set of program instructions to execute at any time within a time window of the program instructions. The determined timing relationship may control a set of one or more program instructions during execution of the set of instructions. A plurality of code segments may be configured to execute on the computer at the determined timing relationship between the plurality of instructions.
(actual abstract) When compiling high-level, graphical code (e.g. LabVIEW&#x2122; code) to a different representation (e.g. different software code or hardware FPGA), information relating to characteristics of the design may be collected/captured from the compilation process, and automatically provided to all the earlier stages of the compilation process to obtain more optimal results. Without automated feedback of this information, users have to manually identify, produce, and provide the feedback information, or forego the process altogether, having to assume that the tool has produced the best possible results when that may not be the case. To correct timing, failed constraints paths may be parsed and compared to delays obtained during a previous compile, and previous adjustments that didn't yield desired results may be undone. The longest delay that didn't result from an undone path may then be identified, and adjusted, and the process may be repeated until all paths are predicted to pass.
(title)
Staged program compilation with automated timing closure

(predicted abstract) A method for the removal of liquid from a liquid-containing material by a pressurized gas is disclosed. The liquid-containing material is mixed with foam for foaming by an in-line mixer. The mixture is then introduced into an open-topped foam chamber having an inlet and an outlet. A pressure differential is established across the inlet and the outlet of the foam chamber whereby gas is drawn from the volume above the liquid-containing material into the foam chamber. The method enables a stable and effective removal of liquid from high-glucose-containing materials without the formation of a foamed and liquid-free foam.

(actual abstract) A quantum information processor can include a control system and a system of processor nodes. Each of the processor nodes can include multiple qubits and an actuator. In some instances, the control system may perform multi-qubit quantum gates on qubits of different processor nodes based on the cross-node quantum interactions. Within each processor node, the qubits interact with the actuator by an intra-node quantum coupling. Between processor nodes, the actuators interact with each other by an inter-node quantum coupling. The cross-node quantum interaction can be produced by non-commutivity of the intra-node quantum couplings and the inter-node quantum couplings. In some instances, the qubits can be manipulated by applying a control sequence that produces an interaction frame where the cross-node quantum interaction dominates the time evolution of the system.

The planetary gear unit may have three rotary elements, with motor power or engine power being input via a first or second rotary element and being output with any one of two transmission gear ratios under the control of first or third rotary element in response to engagement of first and second engaging units. The gear stage forming mechanism may be formed by engagement of gear pairs having different transmission gear ratios with second and third input shafts and a first output shaft, and function to transmit the power from the second or third input shaft to the first output shaft while changing a speed by selecting a gear pair in accordance with a vehicle running speed using a gear pair selector.

In the receiving terminal, one or more UCU(s) may apply receiver policy rules, for instance by limiting the range of wavelengths transmitted to a receive subsystem. (predicted abstract) A method for adaptively setting the inter-frame spacing, between two consecutive frames of a current image, during a corresponding operation of a display device is disclosed. The successive frames are adjacent to each other in the current image. The device has: a display screen, a processor, and an image analysis unit. The display screen includes a plurality of pixels. Each pixel corresponds to one of the consecutive frames. Each pixel displays data. The processor is coupled to the display screen. The image analysis unit is coupled to the processor. When the operation frame is located in one set of consecutive frames of the current image, the image analysis unit obtains an image information for a first pixel in the subsequent frame. While the image information may be obtained, the image analysis unit determines if the subsequent frame is an optimum frame according to an image characteristic of the first pixel. If the subsequent frame is not an optimum frame, the image analysis unit determines if the subsequent frame is an intra-frame frame according to an image characteristic of the first pixel. When the operation frame is located in a next consecutive frame of the current image, the image analysis unit obtains an image information for the first pixel in the next consecutive frame. The image analysis unit also determines if the next consecutive frame is the optimum frame according to the image characteristic of the first pixel. When the next consecutive frame is located in the current frame, the image analysis unit stores the image information obtained for the first pixel in the next consecutive frame.

(actual abstract) The deployment of application revisions and performing of application rollbacks across multiple application servers is streamlined by reducing the number of files that are communicated to the application servers to perform updates and rollbacks. An application service is provided by multiple application servers each executing a plurality of compiled code files associated with the application service. Each application server receives a compiled code file corresponding to an update for one of the plurality of compiled code files associated with the application service. The one compiled code file is replaced with the received compiled code file corresponding to the update. The application servers then provide an updated version of the application service by executing the plurality of compiled code files including the replacement compiled code file corresponding to the update. Application rollback is performed using compiled code files stored in a local repository of each application server.
(title)

When a detection device is installed in the outdoor unit and snow piles up in a snow cover detection area included in the detection device, it is detected using an optical sensor whether snow cover occurs. A value detected by the optical sensor is transmitted to a controller, and the controller compares the value with a default value, and when the controller receives a value different from the default value, the controller controls a fan driving unit to drive a fan. Wind generated by driving the fan removes snow that piles up in the snow cover detection area, a fan guard and a discharge port to prevent the fan from malfunctioning due to accumulated snow.

For a free parking period, the parking occupancy may be estimated based upon vehicle flow data that is indicative of vehicles entering, parking, and/or leaving the one or more parking spaces. In this way, the parking occupancy may be provided to a driver to mitigate wasted time and/or gas otherwise spent searching for an available parking space.

(actual abstract) In palette-based coding, a video coder may form a so-called &#x201c;palette&#x201d; as a table of colors representing the video data of a given block. The video coder may code index values for one or more pixels values of a current block of video data, where the index values indicate entries in the palette that represent the pixel values of the current block. According to the techniques, a video coder determines one or more palette entries in a predictive palette that are copied to the current palette, and a number of new palette entries not in the predictive palette that are included in the current palette. The video coder calculates a size of the current palette equal to the sum of the number of the copied palette entries and the number of the new palette entries, and generates the current palette including the copied palette entries and the new palette entries.

[ 907 ]
(predicted abstract) The method for adaptive computer-aided detection of pulmonary nodules in thoracic computed tomography images has steps consisting in: a) applying a plurality of linear combination of the images into a global binary representation, so as to obtain a multi-level representation of the image, the images, after the global binary representation, providing for each of their pixels an energy, the sum total energy, of the corresponding components of the image; b) calculating the maximum energy of each of the components, and using corresponding pixels of the multi-level representation as a reference; and c) extracting a number of nodules from the area of the image of the whole, the width of each of the pixels being determined by the ratio between the maximum energy of the component and the sum total energy of the components.
(actual abstract) Provided are an apparatus and method for fast and adaptive computer-aided detection of pulmonary nodules and differentiation of malignancy from benignancy in thoracic CT images using a hierarchical vector quantization scheme. Anomalous pulmonary nodules are detected by obtaining a two-dimensional (2D) feature model of a pulmonary nodule, segmenting the pulmonary nodule by performing vector quantification to expand the 2D feature model to a three-dimensional (3D) model, and displaying image information representing whether the pulmonary nodule is benign, based upon the 3D model expanded from the 2D feature model, with duplicate information eliminated by performing feature reduction performed using a principal component analysis and a receiver operating characteristics area under the curve merit analysis. (actual abstract) A printing method is provided. In this printing method, a printing ink composed of pigment-based solvent UV ink or UV ink is applied onto a transfer sheet capable of transmitting an ultraviolet light, and then the printing ink is cured to form a printing ink layer. Thereafter, a bonding ink composed of solvent UV ink or UV ink for bonding the printing ink layer to a medium is applied onto the printing ink layer. Subsequently, the bonding ink is pressed against the medium. In this state, irradiation with the ultraviolet light from an opposite surface of the transfer sheet to a surface having the printing ink layer formed thereon is performed, such that the bonding ink is completely cured to form a bonding ink layer. Thereafter, the transfer sheet is peeled off from the printing ink layer, whereby the printing ink layer is transferred onto the medium.
(title)
